title: 1 Samuel 1:1
content: 1 Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim Zophim, of the hill country of Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite.

title: 1 Samuel 1:2
content: 2 He had two wives. The name of one was Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah. Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.

title: 1 Samuel 1:3
content: 3 This man went up out of his city from year to year to worship and to sacrifice to the LORD of Armies in Shiloh. The two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, priests to the LORD, were there.

title: 1 Samuel 1:4
content: 4 When the day came that Elkanah sacrificed, he gave portions to Peninnah his wife and to all her sons and her daughters;

title: 1 Samuel 1:5
content: 5 but he gave a double portion to Hannah, for he loved Hannah, but the LORD had shut up her womb.

title: 1 Samuel 1:6
content: 6 Her rival provoked her severely, to irritate her, because the LORD had shut up her womb.

title: 1 Samuel 1:7
content: 7 So year by year, when she went up to the LORD’s house, her rival provoked her. Therefore she wept, and didn’t eat.

title: 1 Samuel 1:8
content: 8 Elkanah her husband said to her, “Hannah, why do you weep? Why don’t you eat? Why is your heart grieved? Am I not better to you than ten sons?”

title: 1 Samuel 1:9
content: 9 So Hannah rose up after they had finished eating and drinking in Shiloh. Now Eli the priest was sitting on his seat by the doorpost of the LORD’s temple.

title: 1 Samuel 1:10
content: 10 She was in bitterness of soul, and prayed to the LORD, weeping bitterly.

title: 1 Samuel 1:11
content: 11 She vowed a vow, and said, “LORD of Armies, if you will indeed look at the affliction of your servant and remember me, and not forget your servant, but will give to your servant a boy, then I will give him to the LORD all the days of his life, and no razor shall come on his head.”

title: 1 Samuel 1:12
content: 12 As she continued praying before the LORD, Eli saw her mouth.

title: 1 Samuel 1:13
content: 13 Now Hannah spoke in her heart. Only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard. Therefore Eli thought she was drunk.

title: 1 Samuel 1:14
content: 14 Eli said to her, “How long will you be drunk? Get rid of your wine!”

title: 1 Samuel 1:15
content: 15 Hannah answered, “No, my lord, I am a woman of a sorrowful spirit. I have not been drinking wine or strong drink, but I poured out my soul before the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 1:16
content: 16 Don’t consider your servant a wicked woman; for I have been speaking out of the abundance of my complaint and my provocation.”

title: 1 Samuel 1:17
content: 17 Then Eli answered, “Go in peace; and may the God of Israel grant your petition that you have asked of him.”

title: 1 Samuel 1:18
content: 18 She said, “Let your servant find favor in your sight.” So the woman went her way and ate; and her facial expression wasn’t sad any more.

title: 1 Samuel 1:19
content: 19 They rose up in the morning early and worshiped the LORD, then returned and came to their house to Ramah. Then Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and the LORD remembered her.

title: 1 Samuel 1:20
content: 20 When the time had come, Hannah conceived, and bore a son; and she named him Samuel, saying, “Because I have asked him of the LORD.”

title: 1 Samuel 1:21
content: 21 The man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer to the LORD the yearly sacrifice and his vow.

title: 1 Samuel 1:22
content: 22 But Hannah didn’t go up, for she said to her husband, “Not until the child is weaned; then I will bring him, that he may appear before the LORD, and stay there forever.”

title: 1 Samuel 1:23
content: 23 Elkanah her husband said to her, “Do what seems good to you. Wait until you have weaned him; only may the LORD establish his word.” So the woman waited and nursed her son until she weaned him.

title: 1 Samuel 1:24
content: 24 When she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bulls, and one ephah of meal, and a container of wine, and brought him to the LORD’s house in Shiloh. The child was young.

title: 1 Samuel 1:25
content: 25 They killed the bull, and brought the child to Eli.

title: 1 Samuel 1:26
content: 26 She said, “Oh, my lord, as your soul lives, my lord, I am the woman who stood by you here, praying to the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 1:27
content: 27 I prayed for this child, and the LORD has given me my petition which I asked of him.

title: 1 Samuel 1:28
content: 28 Therefore I have also given him to the LORD. As long as he lives he is given to the LORD.” He worshiped the LORD there.

title: 1 Samuel 2:1
content: 1 Hannah prayed, and said, “My heart exults in the LORD! My horn is exalted in the LORD. My mouth is enlarged over my enemies, because I rejoice in your salvation.

title: 1 Samuel 2:2
content: 2 There is no one as holy as the LORD, for there is no one besides you, nor is there any rock like our God.

title: 1 Samuel 2:3
content: 3 “Don’t keep talking so exceedingly proudly. Don’t let arrogance come out of your mouth, for the LORD is a God of knowledge. By him actions are weighed.

title: 1 Samuel 2:4
content: 4 “The bows of the mighty men are broken. Those who stumbled are armed with strength.

title: 1 Samuel 2:5
content: 5 Those who were full have hired themselves out for bread. Those who were hungry are satisfied. Yes, the barren has borne seven. She who has many children languishes.

title: 1 Samuel 2:6
content: 6 “The LORD kills and makes alive. He brings down to Sheol and brings up.

title: 1 Samuel 2:7
content: 7 The LORD makes poor and makes rich. He brings low, he also lifts up.

title: 1 Samuel 2:8
content: 8 He raises up the poor out of the dust. He lifts up the needy from the dunghill to make them sit with princes and inherit the throne of glory. For the pillars of the earth are the LORD’s. He has set the world on them.

title: 1 Samuel 2:9
content: 9 He will keep the feet of his holy ones, but the wicked will be put to silence in darkness; for no man will prevail by strength.

title: 1 Samuel 2:10
content: 10 Those who strive with the LORD shall be broken to pieces. He will thunder against them in the sky. “The LORD will judge the ends of the earth. He will give strength to his king, and exalt the horn of his anointed.”

title: 1 Samuel 2:11
content: 11 Elkanah went to Ramah to his house. The child served the LORD before Eli the priest.

title: 1 Samuel 2:12
content: 12 Now the sons of Eli were wicked men. They didn’t know the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 2:13
content: 13 The custom of the priests with the people was that when anyone offered a sacrifice, the priest’s servant came while the meat was boiling, with a fork of three teeth in his hand;

title: 1 Samuel 2:14
content: 14 and he stabbed it into the pan, or kettle, or cauldron, or pot. The priest took all that the fork brought up for himself. They did this to all the Israelites who came there to Shiloh.

title: 1 Samuel 2:15
content: 15 Yes, before they burned the fat, the priest’s servant came, and said to the man who sacrificed, “Give meat to roast for the priest; for he will not accept boiled meat from you, but raw.”

title: 1 Samuel 2:16
content: 16 If the man said to him, “Let the fat be burned first, and then take as much as your soul desires;” then he would say, “No, but you shall give it to me now; and if not, I will take it by force.”

title: 1 Samuel 2:17
content: 17 The sin of the young men was very great before the LORD; for the men despised the LORD’s offering.

title: 1 Samuel 2:18
content: 18 But Samuel ministered before the LORD, being a child, clothed with a linen ephod.

title: 1 Samuel 2:19
content: 19 Moreover his mother made him a little robe, and brought it to him from year to year when she came up with her husband to offer the yearly sacrifice.

title: 1 Samuel 2:20
content: 20 Eli blessed Elkanah and his wife, and said, “May the LORD give you offspring from this woman for the petition which was asked of the LORD.” Then they went to their own home.

title: 1 Samuel 2:21
content: 21 The LORD visited Hannah, and she conceived and bore three sons and two daughters. The child Samuel grew before the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 2:22
content: 22 Now Eli was very old; and he heard all that his sons did to all Israel, and how that they slept with the women who served at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

title: 1 Samuel 2:23
content: 23 He said to them, “Why do you do such things? For I hear of your evil dealings from all these people.

title: 1 Samuel 2:24
content: 24 No, my sons; for it is not a good report that I hear! You make the LORD’s people disobey.

title: 1 Samuel 2:25
content: 25 If one man sins against another, God will judge him; but if a man sins against the LORD, who will intercede for him?” Notwithstanding, they didn’t listen to the voice of their father, because the LORD intended to kill them.

title: 1 Samuel 2:26
content: 26 The child Samuel grew on, and increased in favor both with the LORD and also with men.

title: 1 Samuel 2:27
content: 27 A man of God came to Eli and said to him, “The LORD says, ‘Did I reveal myself to the house of your father when they were in Egypt in bondage to Pharaoh’s house?

title: 1 Samuel 2:28
content: 28 Didn’t I choose him out of all the tribes of Israel to be my priest, to go up to my altar, to burn incense, to wear an ephod before me? Didn’t I give to the house of your father all the offerings of the children of Israel made by fire?

title: 1 Samuel 2:29
content: 29 Why do you kick at my sacrifice and at my offering, which I have commanded in my habitation, and honor your sons above me, to make yourselves fat with the best of all the offerings of Israel my people?’

title: 1 Samuel 2:30
content: 30 “Therefore the LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘I said indeed that your house and the house of your father should walk before me forever.’ But now the LORD says, ‘Far be it from me; for those who honor me I will honor, and those who despise me will be cursed.

title: 1 Samuel 2:31
content: 31 Behold, the days come that I will cut off your arm and the arm of your father’s house, that there will not be an old man in your house.

title: 1 Samuel 2:32
content: 32 You will see the affliction of my habitation, in all the wealth which I will give Israel. There shall not be an old man in your house forever.

title: 1 Samuel 2:33
content: 33 The man of yours whom I don’t cut off from my altar will consume your eyes and grieve your heart. All the increase of your house will die in the flower of their age.

title: 1 Samuel 2:34
content: 34 This will be the sign to you that will come on your two sons, on Hophni and Phinehas: in one day they will both die.

title: 1 Samuel 2:35
content: 35 I will raise up a faithful priest for myself who will do according to that which is in my heart and in my mind. I will build him a sure house. He will walk before my anointed forever.

title: 1 Samuel 2:36
content: 36 It will happen that everyone who is left in your house will come and bow down to him for a piece of silver and a loaf of bread, and will say, “Please put me into one of the priests’ offices, that I may eat a morsel of bread.”’”

title: 1 Samuel 3:1
content: 1 The child Samuel ministered to the LORD before Eli. The LORD’s word was rare in those days. There were not many visions, then.

title: 1 Samuel 3:2
content: 2 At that time, when Eli was laid down in his place (now his eyes had begun to grow dim, so that he could not see),

title: 1 Samuel 3:3
content: 3 and God’s lamp hadn’t yet gone out, and Samuel had laid down in the LORD’s temple where God’s ark was,

title: 1 Samuel 3:4
content: 4 The LORD called Samuel. He said, “Here I am.”

title: 1 Samuel 3:5
content: 5 He ran to Eli and said, “Here I am; for you called me.” He said, “I didn’t call. Lie down again.” He went and lay down.

title: 1 Samuel 3:6
content: 6 The LORD called yet again, “Samuel!” Samuel arose and went to Eli and said, “Here I am; for you called me.” He answered, “I didn’t call, my son. Lie down again.”

title: 1 Samuel 3:7
content: 7 Now Samuel didn’t yet know the LORD, neither was the LORD’s word yet revealed to him.

title: 1 Samuel 3:8
content: 8 The LORD called Samuel again the third time. He arose and went to Eli and said, “Here I am; for you called me.” Eli perceived that the LORD had called the child.

title: 1 Samuel 3:9
content: 9 Therefore Eli said to Samuel, “Go, lie down. It shall be, if he calls you, that you shall say, ‘Speak, LORD; for your servant hears.’” So Samuel went and lay down in his place.

title: 1 Samuel 3:10
content: 10 The LORD came, and stood, and called as at other times, “Samuel! Samuel!” Then Samuel said, “Speak; for your servant hears.”

title: 1 Samuel 3:11
content: 11 The LORD said to Samuel, “Behold, I will do a thing in Israel at which both the ears of everyone who hears it will tingle.

title: 1 Samuel 3:12
content: 12 In that day I will perform against Eli all that I have spoken concerning his house, from the beginning even to the end.

title: 1 Samuel 3:13
content: 13 For I have told him that I will judge his house forever for the iniquity which he knew, because his sons brought a curse on themselves, and he didn’t restrain them.

title: 1 Samuel 3:14
content: 14 Therefore I have sworn to the house of Eli that the iniquity of Eli’s house shall not be removed with sacrifice or offering forever.”

title: 1 Samuel 3:15
content: 15 Samuel lay until the morning, and opened the doors of the LORD’s house. Samuel was afraid to show Eli the vision.

title: 1 Samuel 3:16
content: 16 Then Eli called Samuel and said, “Samuel, my son!” He said, “Here I am.”

title: 1 Samuel 3:17
content: 17 He said, “What is the thing that he has spoken to you? Please don’t hide it from me. God do so to you, and more also, if you hide anything from me of all the things that he spoke to you.”

title: 1 Samuel 3:18
content: 18 Samuel told him every bit, and hid nothing from him. He said, “It is the LORD. Let him do what seems good to him.”

title: 1 Samuel 3:19
content: 19 Samuel grew, and the LORD was with him and let none of his words fall to the ground.

title: 1 Samuel 3:20
content: 20 All Israel from Dan even to Beersheba knew that Samuel was established to be a prophet of the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 3:21
content: 21 The LORD appeared again in Shiloh; for the LORD revealed himself to Samuel in Shiloh by the LORD’s word.

title: 1 Samuel 4:1
content: 1 The word of Samuel came to all Israel. Now Israel went out against the Philistines to battle, and encamped beside Ebenezer; and the Philistines encamped in Aphek.

title: 1 Samuel 4:2
content: 2 The Philistines put themselves in array against Israel. When they joined battle, Israel was defeated by the Philistines, who killed about four thousand men of the army in the field.

title: 1 Samuel 4:3
content: 3 When the people had come into the camp, the elders of Israel said, “Why has the LORD defeated us today before the Philistines? Let’s get the ark of the LORD’s covenant out of Shiloh and bring it to us, that it may come among us and save us out of the hand of our enemies.”

title: 1 Samuel 4:4
content: 4 So the people sent to Shiloh, and they brought from there the ark of the covenant of the LORD of Armies, who sits above the cherubim; and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were there with the ark of the covenant of God.

title: 1 Samuel 4:5
content: 5 When the ark of the LORD’s covenant came into the camp, all Israel shouted with a great shout, so that the earth resounded.

title: 1 Samuel 4:6
content: 6 When the Philistines heard the noise of the shout, they said, “What does the noise of this great shout in the camp of the Hebrews mean?” They understood that the LORD’s ark had come into the camp.

title: 1 Samuel 4:7
content: 7 The Philistines were afraid, for they said, “God has come into the camp.” They said, “Woe to us! For there has not been such a thing before.

title: 1 Samuel 4:8
content: 8 Woe to us! Who shall deliver us out of the hand of these mighty gods? These are the gods that struck the Egyptians with all kinds of plagues in the wilderness.

title: 1 Samuel 4:9
content: 9 Be strong and behave like men, O you Philistines, that you not be servants to the Hebrews, as they have been to you. Strengthen yourselves like men, and fight!”

title: 1 Samuel 4:10
content: 10 The Philistines fought, and Israel was defeated, and each man fled to his tent. There was a very great slaughter; for thirty thousand footmen of Israel fell.

title: 1 Samuel 4:11
content: 11 God’s ark was taken; and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were slain.

title: 1 Samuel 4:12
content: 12 A man of Benjamin ran out of the army and came to Shiloh the same day, with his clothes torn and with dirt on his head.

title: 1 Samuel 4:13
content: 13 When he came, behold, Eli was sitting on his seat by the road watching, for his heart trembled for God’s ark. When the man came into the city and told about it, all the city cried out.

title: 1 Samuel 4:14
content: 14 When Eli heard the noise of the crying, he said, “What does the noise of this tumult mean?” The man hurried, and came and told Eli.

title: 1 Samuel 4:15
content: 15 Now Eli was ninety-eight years old. His eyes were set, so that he could not see.

title: 1 Samuel 4:16
content: 16 The man said to Eli, “I am he who came out of the army, and I fled today out of the army.” He said, “How did the matter go, my son?”

title: 1 Samuel 4:17
content: 17 He who brought the news answered, “Israel has fled before the Philistines, and there has been also a great slaughter among the people. Your two sons also, Hophni and Phinehas, are dead, and God’s ark has been captured.”

title: 1 Samuel 4:18
content: 18 When he made mention of God’s ark, Eli fell from off his seat backward by the side of the gate; and his neck broke, and he died, for he was an old man and heavy. He had judged Israel forty years.

title: 1 Samuel 4:19
content: 19 His daughter-in-law, Phinehas’ wife, was with child, near to giving birth. When she heard the news that God’s ark was taken and that her father-in-law and her husband were dead, she bowed herself and gave birth; for her pains came on her.

title: 1 Samuel 4:20
content: 20 About the time of her death the women who stood by her said to her, “Don’t be afraid, for you have given birth to a son.” But she didn’t answer, neither did she regard it.

title: 1 Samuel 4:21
content: 21 She named the child Ichabod, saying, “The glory has departed from Israel!” because God’s ark was taken, and because of her father-in-law and her husband.

title: 1 Samuel 4:22
content: 22 She said, “The glory has departed from Israel; for God’s ark has been taken.”

title: 1 Samuel 5:1
content: 1 Now the Philistines had taken God’s ark, and they brought it from Ebenezer to Ashdod.

title: 1 Samuel 5:2
content: 2 The Philistines took God’s ark, and brought it into the house of Dagon and set it by Dagon.

title: 1 Samuel 5:3
content: 3 When the people of Ashdod arose early on the next day, behold, Dagon had fallen on his face to the ground before the LORD’s ark. They took Dagon and set him in his place again.

title: 1 Samuel 5:4
content: 4 When they arose early on the following morning, behold, Dagon had fallen on his face to the ground before the LORD’s ark; and the head of Dagon and both the palms of his hands were cut off on the threshold. Only Dagon’s torso was intact.

title: 1 Samuel 5:5
content: 5 Therefore neither the priests of Dagon nor any who come into Dagon’s house step on the threshold of Dagon in Ashdod to this day.

title: 1 Samuel 5:6
content: 6 But the LORD’s hand was heavy on the people of Ashdod, and he destroyed them and struck them with tumors, even Ashdod and its borders.

title: 1 Samuel 5:7
content: 7 When the men of Ashdod saw that it was so, they said, “The ark of the God of Israel shall not stay with us, for his hand is severe on us and on Dagon our god.”

title: 1 Samuel 5:8
content: 8 They sent therefore and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines, and said, “What shall we do with the ark of the God of Israel?” They answered, “Let the ark of the God of Israel be carried over to Gath.” They carried the ark of the God of Israel there.

title: 1 Samuel 5:9
content: 9 It was so, that after they had carried it there, the LORD’s hand was against the city with a very great confusion; and he struck the men of the city, both small and great, so that tumors broke out on them.

title: 1 Samuel 5:10
content: 10 So they sent God’s ark to Ekron. As God’s ark came to Ekron, the Ekronites cried out, saying, “They have brought the ark of the God of Israel here to us, to kill us and our people.”

title: 1 Samuel 5:11
content: 11 They sent therefore and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines, and they said, “Send the ark of the God of Israel away, and let it go again to its own place, that it not kill us and our people.” For there was a deadly panic throughout all the city. The hand of God was very heavy there.

title: 1 Samuel 5:12
content: 12 The men who didn’t die were struck with the tumors; and the cry of the city went up to heaven.

title: 1 Samuel 6:1
content: 1 The LORD’s ark was in the country of the Philistines seven months.

title: 1 Samuel 6:2
content: 2 The Philistines called for the priests and the diviners, saying, “What shall we do with the LORD’s ark? Show us how we should send it to its place.”

title: 1 Samuel 6:3
content: 3 They said, “If you send away the ark of the God of Israel, don’t send it empty; but by all means return a trespass offering to him. Then you will be healed, and it will be known to you why his hand is not removed from you.”

title: 1 Samuel 6:4
content: 4 Then they said, “What should the trespass offering be which we shall return to him?” They said, “Five golden tumors and five golden mice, for the number of the lords of the Philistines; for one plague was on you all, and on your lords.

title: 1 Samuel 6:5
content: 5 Therefore you shall make images of your tumors and images of your mice that mar the land; and you shall give glory to the God of Israel. Perhaps he will release his hand from you, from your gods, and from your land.

title: 1 Samuel 6:6
content: 6 Why then do you harden your hearts as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts? When he had worked wonderfully among them, didn’t they let the people go, and they departed?

title: 1 Samuel 6:7
content: 7 “Now therefore take and prepare yourselves a new cart and two milk cows on which there has come no yoke; and tie the cows to the cart, and bring their calves home from them;

title: 1 Samuel 6:8
content: 8 and take the LORD’s ark and lay it on the cart. Put the jewels of gold, which you return him for a trespass offering, in a box by its side; and send it away, that it may go.

title: 1 Samuel 6:9
content: 9 Behold, if it goes up by the way of its own border to Beth Shemesh, then he has done us this great evil; but if not, then we shall know that it is not his hand that struck us. It was a chance that happened to us.”

title: 1 Samuel 6:10
content: 10 The men did so, and took two milk cows and tied them to the cart, and shut up their calves at home.

title: 1 Samuel 6:11
content: 11 They put the LORD’s ark on the cart, and the box with the golden mice and the images of their tumors.

title: 1 Samuel 6:12
content: 12 The cows took the straight way by the way to Beth Shemesh. They went along the highway, lowing as they went, and didn’t turn away to the right hand or to the left; and the lords of the Philistines went after them to the border of Beth Shemesh.

title: 1 Samuel 6:13
content: 13 The people of Beth Shemesh were reaping their wheat harvest in the valley; and they lifted up their eyes and saw the ark, and rejoiced to see it.

title: 1 Samuel 6:14
content: 14 The cart came into the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh, and stood there, where there was a great stone. Then they split the wood of the cart and offered up the cows for a burnt offering to the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 6:15
content: 15 The Levites took down the LORD’s ark and the box that was with it, in which the jewels of gold were, and put them on the great stone; and the men of Beth Shemesh offered burnt offerings and sacrificed sacrifices the same day to the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 6:16
content: 16 When the five lords of the Philistines had seen it, they returned to Ekron the same day.

title: 1 Samuel 6:17
content: 17 These are the golden tumors which the Philistines returned for a trespass offering to the LORD: for Ashdod one, for Gaza one, for Ashkelon one, for Gath one, for Ekron one;

title: 1 Samuel 6:18
content: 18 and the golden mice, according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines belonging to the five lords, both of fortified cities and of country villages, even to the great stone on which they set down the LORD’s ark. That stone remains to this day in the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh.

title: 1 Samuel 6:19
content: 19 He struck of the men of Beth Shemesh, because they had looked into the LORD’s ark, he struck fifty thousand seventy of the men. Then the people mourned, because the LORD had struck the people with a great slaughter.

title: 1 Samuel 6:20
content: 20 The men of Beth Shemesh said, “Who is able to stand before the LORD, this holy God? To whom shall he go up from us?”

title: 1 Samuel 6:21
content: 21 They sent messengers to the inhabitants of Kiriath Jearim, saying, “The Philistines have brought back the LORD’s ark. Come down and bring it up to yourselves.”

title: 1 Samuel 7:1
content: 1 The men of Kiriath Jearim came and took the LORD’s ark, and brought it into Abinadab’s house on the hill, and consecrated Eleazar his son to keep the LORD’s ark.

title: 1 Samuel 7:2
content: 2 From the day that the ark stayed in Kiriath Jearim, the time was long—for it was twenty years; and all the house of Israel lamented after the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 7:3
content: 3 Samuel spoke to all the house of Israel, saying, “If you are returning to the LORD with all your heart, then put away the foreign gods and the Ashtaroth from among you, and direct your hearts to the LORD, and serve him only; and he will deliver you out of the hand of the Philistines.”

title: 1 Samuel 7:4
content: 4 Then the children of Israel removed the Baals and the Ashtaroth, and served the LORD only.

title: 1 Samuel 7:5
content: 5 Samuel said, “Gather all Israel to Mizpah, and I will pray to the LORD for you.”

title: 1 Samuel 7:6
content: 6 They gathered together to Mizpah, and drew water, and poured it out before the LORD, and fasted on that day, and said there, “We have sinned against the LORD.” Samuel judged the children of Israel in Mizpah.

title: 1 Samuel 7:7
content: 7 When the Philistines heard that the children of Israel were gathered together at Mizpah, the lords of the Philistines went up against Israel. When the children of Israel heard it, they were afraid of the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel 7:8
content: 8 The children of Israel said to Samuel, “Don’t stop crying to the LORD our God for us, that he will save us out of the hand of the Philistines.”

title: 1 Samuel 7:9
content: 9 Samuel took a suckling lamb, and offered it for a whole burnt offering to the LORD. Samuel cried to the LORD for Israel, and the LORD answered him.

title: 1 Samuel 7:10
content: 10 As Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines came near to battle against Israel; but the LORD thundered with a great thunder on that day on the Philistines and confused them; and they were struck down before Israel.

title: 1 Samuel 7:11
content: 11 The men of Israel went out of Mizpah and pursued the Philistines, and struck them until they came under Beth Kar.

title: 1 Samuel 7:12
content: 12 Then Samuel took a stone and set it between Mizpah and Shen, and called its name Ebenezer, saying, “The LORD helped us until now.”

title: 1 Samuel 7:13
content: 13 So the Philistines were subdued, and they stopped coming within the border of Israel. The LORD’s hand was against the Philistines all the days of Samuel.

title: 1 Samuel 7:14
content: 14 The cities which the Philistines had taken from Israel were restored to Israel, from Ekron even to Gath; and Israel recovered its border out of the hand of the Philistines. There was peace between Israel and the Amorites.

title: 1 Samuel 7:15
content: 15 Samuel judged Israel all the days of his life.

title: 1 Samuel 7:16
content: 16 He went from year to year in a circuit to Bethel, Gilgal, and Mizpah; and he judged Israel in all those places.

title: 1 Samuel 7:17
content: 17 His return was to Ramah, for his house was there, and he judged Israel there; and he built an altar to the LORD there.

title: 1 Samuel 8:1
content: 1 When Samuel was old, he made his sons judges over Israel.

title: 1 Samuel 8:2
content: 2 Now the name of his firstborn was Joel, and the name of his second, Abijah. They were judges in Beersheba.

title: 1 Samuel 8:3
content: 3 His sons didn’t walk in his ways, but turned away after dishonest gain, took bribes, and perverted justice.

title: 1 Samuel 8:4
content: 4 Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together and came to Samuel to Ramah.

title: 1 Samuel 8:5
content: 5 They said to him, “Behold, you are old, and your sons don’t walk in your ways. Now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.”

title: 1 Samuel 8:6
content: 6 But the thing displeased Samuel when they said, “Give us a king to judge us.” Samuel prayed to the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 8:7
content: 7 The LORD said to Samuel, “Listen to the voice of the people in all that they tell you; for they have not rejected you, but they have rejected me as the king over them.

title: 1 Samuel 8:8
content: 8 According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even to this day, in that they have forsaken me and served other gods, so they also do to you.

title: 1 Samuel 8:9
content: 9 Now therefore, listen to their voice. However, you shall protest solemnly to them, and shall show them the way of the king who will reign over them.”

title: 1 Samuel 8:10
content: 10 Samuel told all the LORD’s words to the people who asked him for a king.

title: 1 Samuel 8:11
content: 11 He said, “This will be the way of the king who shall reign over you: he will take your sons and appoint them as his servants, for his chariots and to be his horsemen; and they will run before his chariots.

title: 1 Samuel 8:12
content: 12 He will appoint them to him for captains of thousands and captains of fifties; and he will assign some to plow his ground and to reap his harvest; and to make his instruments of war and the instruments of his chariots.

title: 1 Samuel 8:13
content: 13 He will take your daughters to be perfumers, to be cooks, and to be bakers.

title: 1 Samuel 8:14
content: 14 He will take your fields, your vineyards, and your olive groves, even your best, and give them to his servants.

title: 1 Samuel 8:15
content: 15 He will take one tenth of your seed and of your vineyards, and give it to his officers and to his servants.

title: 1 Samuel 8:16
content: 16 He will take your male servants, your female servants, your best young men, and your donkeys, and assign them to his own work.

title: 1 Samuel 8:17
content: 17 He will take one tenth of your flocks; and you will be his servants.

title: 1 Samuel 8:18
content: 18 You will cry out in that day because of your king whom you will have chosen for yourselves; and the LORD will not answer you in that day.”

title: 1 Samuel 8:19
content: 19 But the people refused to listen to the voice of Samuel; and they said, “No, but we will have a king over us,

title: 1 Samuel 8:20
content: 20 that we also may be like all the nations; and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.”

title: 1 Samuel 8:21
content: 21 Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 8:22
content: 22 The LORD said to Samuel, “Listen to their voice, and make them a king.” Samuel said to the men of Israel, “Everyone go to your own city.”

title: 1 Samuel 9:1
content: 1 Now there was a man of Benjamin, whose name was Kish the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Becorath, the son of Aphiah, the son of a Benjamite, a mighty man of valor.

title: 1 Samuel 9:2
content: 2 He had a son whose name was Saul, an impressive young man; and there was not among the children of Israel a more handsome person than he. From his shoulders and upward he was taller than any of the people.

title: 1 Samuel 9:3
content: 3 The donkeys of Kish, Saul’s father, were lost. Kish said to Saul his son, “Now take one of the servants with you, and arise, go look for the donkeys.”

title: 1 Samuel 9:4
content: 4 He passed through the hill country of Ephraim, and passed through the land of Shalishah, but they didn’t find them. Then they passed through the land of Shaalim, and they weren’t there. Then he passed through the land of the Benjamites, but they didn’t find them.

title: 1 Samuel 9:5
content: 5 When they had come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant who was with him, “Come! Let’s return, lest my father stop caring about the donkeys and be anxious for us.”

title: 1 Samuel 9:6
content: 6 The servant said to him, “Behold now, there is a man of God in this city, and he is a man who is held in honor. All that he says surely happens. Now let’s go there. Perhaps he can tell us which way to go.”

title: 1 Samuel 9:7
content: 7 Then Saul said to his servant, “But behold, if we go, what should we bring the man? For the bread is spent in our sacks, and there is not a present to bring to the man of God. What do we have?”

title: 1 Samuel 9:8
content: 8 The servant answered Saul again and said, “Behold, I have in my hand the fourth part of a shekel of silver. I will give that to the man of God, to tell us our way.”

title: 1 Samuel 9:9
content: 9 (In earlier times in Israel, when a man went to inquire of God, he said, “Come! Let’s go to the seer;” for he who is now called a prophet was before called a seer.)

title: 1 Samuel 9:10
content: 10 Then Saul said to his servant, “Well said. Come! Let’s go.” So they went to the city where the man of God was.

title: 1 Samuel 9:11
content: 11 As they went up the ascent to the city, they found young maidens going out to draw water, and said to them, “Is the seer here?”

title: 1 Samuel 9:12
content: 12 They answered them and said, “He is. Behold, he is before you. Hurry now, for he has come today into the city; for the people have a sacrifice today in the high place.

title: 1 Samuel 9:13
content: 13 As soon as you have come into the city, you will immediately find him before he goes up to the high place to eat; for the people will not eat until he comes, because he blesses the sacrifice. Afterwards those who are invited eat. Now therefore go up; for at this time you will find him.”

title: 1 Samuel 9:14
content: 14 They went up to the city. As they came within the city, behold, Samuel came out toward them to go up to the high place.

title: 1 Samuel 9:15
content: 15 Now the LORD had revealed to Samuel a day before Saul came, saying,

title: 1 Samuel 9:16
content: 16 “Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man out of the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him to be prince over my people Israel. He will save my people out of the hand of the Philistines; for I have looked upon my people, because their cry has come to me.”

title: 1 Samuel 9:17
content: 17 When Samuel saw Saul, the LORD said to him, “Behold, the man of whom I spoke to you! He will have authority over my people.”

title: 1 Samuel 9:18
content: 18 Then Saul approached Samuel in the gateway, and said, “Please tell me where the seer’s house is.”

title: 1 Samuel 9:19
content: 19 Samuel answered Saul and said, “I am the seer. Go up before me to the high place, for you are to eat with me today. In the morning I will let you go and will tell you all that is in your heart.

title: 1 Samuel 9:20
content: 20 As for your donkeys who were lost three days ago, don’t set your mind on them, for they have been found. For whom does all Israel desire? Is it not you and all your father’s house?”

title: 1 Samuel 9:21
content: 21 Saul answered, “Am I not a Benjamite, of the smallest of the tribes of Israel? And my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? Why then do you speak to me like this?”

title: 1 Samuel 9:22
content: 22 Samuel took Saul and his servant and brought them into the guest room, and made them sit in the best place among those who were invited, who were about thirty persons.

title: 1 Samuel 9:23
content: 23 Samuel said to the cook, “Bring the portion which I gave you, of which I said to you, ‘Set it aside.’”

title: 1 Samuel 9:24
content: 24 The cook took up the thigh, and that which was on it, and set it before Saul. Samuel said, “Behold, that which has been reserved! Set it before yourself and eat; because it has been kept for you for the appointed time, for I said, ‘I have invited the people.’” So Saul ate with Samuel that day.

title: 1 Samuel 9:25
content: 25 When they had come down from the high place into the city, he talked with Saul on the housetop.

title: 1 Samuel 9:26
content: 26 They arose early; and about daybreak, Samuel called to Saul on the housetop, saying, “Get up, that I may send you away.” Saul arose, and they both went outside, he and Samuel, together.

title: 1 Samuel 9:27
content: 27 As they were going down at the end of the city, Samuel said to Saul, “Tell the servant to go on ahead of us.” He went ahead, then Samuel said, “But stand still first, that I may cause you to hear God’s message.”

title: 1 Samuel 10:1
content: 1 Then Samuel took the vial of oil and poured it on his head, then kissed him and said, “Hasn’t the LORD anointed you to be prince over his inheritance?

title: 1 Samuel 10:2
content: 2 When you have departed from me today, then you will find two men by Rachel’s tomb, on the border of Benjamin at Zelzah. They will tell you, ‘The donkeys which you went to look for have been found; and behold, your father has stopped caring about the donkeys and is anxious for you, saying, “What shall I do for my son?”’

title: 1 Samuel 10:3
content: 3 “Then you will go on forward from there, and you will come to the oak of Tabor. Three men will meet you there going up to God to Bethel: one carrying three young goats, and another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a container of wine.

title: 1 Samuel 10:4
content: 4 They will greet you and give you two loaves of bread, which you shall receive from their hand.

title: 1 Samuel 10:5
content: 5 “After that you will come to the hill of God, where the garrison of the Philistines is; and it will happen, when you have come there to the city, that you will meet a band of prophets coming down from the high place with a lute, a tambourine, a pipe, and a harp before them; and they will be prophesying.

title: 1 Samuel 10:6
content: 6 Then the LORD’s Spirit will come mightily on you, then you will prophesy with them and will be turned into another man.

title: 1 Samuel 10:7
content: 7 Let it be, when these signs have come to you, that you do what is appropriate for the occasion; for God is with you.

title: 1 Samuel 10:8
content: 8 “Go down ahead of me to Gilgal; and behold, I will come down to you to offer burnt offerings and to sacrifice sacrifices of peace offerings. Wait seven days, until I come to you and show you what you are to do.”

title: 1 Samuel 10:9
content: 9 It was so, that when he had turned his back to go from Samuel, God gave him another heart; and all those signs happened that day.

title: 1 Samuel 10:10
content: 10 When they came there to the hill, behold, a band of prophets met him; and the Spirit of God came mightily on him, and he prophesied among them.

title: 1 Samuel 10:11
content: 11 When all who knew him before saw that, behold, he prophesied with the prophets, then the people said to one another, “What is this that has come to the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?”

title: 1 Samuel 10:12
content: 12 One from the same place answered, “Who is their father?” Therefore it became a proverb, “Is Saul also among the prophets?”

title: 1 Samuel 10:13
content: 13 When he had finished prophesying, he came to the high place.

title: 1 Samuel 10:14
content: 14 Saul’s uncle said to him and to his servant, “Where did you go?” He said, “To seek the donkeys. When we saw that they were not found, we came to Samuel.”

title: 1 Samuel 10:15
content: 15 Saul’s uncle said, “Please tell me what Samuel said to you.”

title: 1 Samuel 10:16
content: 16 Saul said to his uncle, “He told us plainly that the donkeys were found.” But concerning the matter of the kingdom, of which Samuel spoke, he didn’t tell him.

title: 1 Samuel 10:17
content: 17 Samuel called the people together to the LORD to Mizpah;

title: 1 Samuel 10:18
content: 18 and he said to the children of Israel, “The LORD, the God of Israel, says ‘I brought Israel up out of Egypt and I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all the kingdoms that oppressed you.’

title: 1 Samuel 10:19
content: 19 But you have today rejected your God, who himself saves you out of all your calamities and your distresses; and you have said to him, ‘No! Set a king over us!’ Now therefore present yourselves before the LORD by your tribes and by your thousands.”

title: 1 Samuel 10:20
content: 20 So Samuel brought all the tribes of Israel near, and the tribe of Benjamin was chosen.

title: 1 Samuel 10:21
content: 21 He brought the tribe of Benjamin near by their families and the family of the Matrites was chosen. Then Saul the son of Kish was chosen; but when they looked for him, he could not be found.

title: 1 Samuel 10:22
content: 22 Therefore they asked of the LORD further, “Is there yet a man to come here?” The LORD answered, “Behold, he has hidden himself among the baggage.”

title: 1 Samuel 10:23
content: 23 They ran and got him there. When he stood among the people, he was higher than any of the people from his shoulders and upward.

title: 1 Samuel 10:24
content: 24 Samuel said to all the people, “Do you see him whom the LORD has chosen, that there is no one like him among all the people?” All the people shouted and said, “Long live the king!”

title: 1 Samuel 10:25
content: 25 Then Samuel told the people the regulations of the kingdom, and wrote it in a book and laid it up before the LORD. Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.

title: 1 Samuel 10:26
content: 26 Saul also went to his house in Gibeah; and the army went with him, whose hearts God had touched.

title: 1 Samuel 10:27
content: 27 But certain worthless fellows said, “How could this man save us?” They despised him, and brought him no tribute. But he held his peace.

title: 1 Samuel 11:1
content: 1 Then Nahash the Ammonite came up and encamped against Jabesh Gilead; and all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash, “Make a covenant with us, and we will serve you.”

title: 1 Samuel 11:2
content: 2 Nahash the Ammonite said to them, “On this condition I will make it with you, that all your right eyes be gouged out. I will make this dishonor all Israel.”

title: 1 Samuel 11:3
content: 3 The elders of Jabesh said to him, “Give us seven days, that we may send messengers to all the borders of Israel; and then, if there is no one to save us, we will come out to you.”

title: 1 Samuel 11:4
content: 4 Then the messengers came to Gibeah of Saul, and spoke these words in the ears of the people, then all the people lifted up their voice and wept.

title: 1 Samuel 11:5
content: 5 Behold, Saul came following the oxen out of the field; and Saul said, “What ails the people that they weep?” They told him the words of the men of Jabesh.

title: 1 Samuel 11:6
content: 6 God’s Spirit came mightily on Saul when he heard those words, and his anger burned hot.

title: 1 Samuel 11:7
content: 7 He took a yoke of oxen and cut them in pieces, then sent them throughout all the borders of Israel by the hand of messengers, saying, “Whoever doesn’t come out after Saul and after Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen.” The dread of the LORD fell on the people, and they came out as one man.

title: 1 Samuel 11:8
content: 8 He counted them in Bezek; and the children of Israel were three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.

title: 1 Samuel 11:9
content: 9 They said to the messengers who came, “Tell the men of Jabesh Gilead, ‘Tomorrow, by the time the sun is hot, you will be rescued.’” The messengers came and told the men of Jabesh; and they were glad.

title: 1 Samuel 11:10
content: 10 Therefore the men of Jabesh said, “Tomorrow we will come out to you, and you shall do with us all that seems good to you.”

title: 1 Samuel 11:11
content: 11 On the next day, Saul put the people in three companies; and they came into the middle of the camp in the morning watch, and struck the Ammonites until the heat of the day. Those who remained were scattered, so that no two of them were left together.

title: 1 Samuel 11:12
content: 12 The people said to Samuel, “Who is he who said, ‘Shall Saul reign over us?’ Bring those men, that we may put them to death!”

title: 1 Samuel 11:13
content: 13 Saul said, “No man shall be put to death today; for today the LORD has rescued Israel.”

title: 1 Samuel 11:14
content: 14 Then Samuel said to the people, “Come! Let’s go to Gilgal, and renew the kingdom there.”

title: 1 Samuel 11:15
content: 15 All the people went to Gilgal; and there they made Saul king before the LORD in Gilgal. There they offered sacrifices of peace offerings before the LORD; and there Saul and all the men of Israel rejoiced greatly.

title: 1 Samuel 12:1
content: 1 Samuel said to all Israel, “Behold, I have listened to your voice in all that you said to me, and have made a king over you.

title: 1 Samuel 12:2
content: 2 Now, behold, the king walks before you. I am old and gray-headed. Behold, my sons are with you. I have walked before you from my youth to this day.

title: 1 Samuel 12:3
content: 3 Here I am. Witness against me before the LORD and before his anointed. Whose ox have I taken? Whose donkey have I taken? Whom have I defrauded? Whom have I oppressed? Of whose hand have I taken a bribe to make me blind my eyes? I will restore it to you.”

title: 1 Samuel 12:4
content: 4 They said, “You have not defrauded us, nor oppressed us, neither have you taken anything from anyone’s hand.”

title: 1 Samuel 12:5
content: 5 He said to them, “The LORD is witness against you, and his anointed is witness today, that you have not found anything in my hand.” They said, “He is witness.”

title: 1 Samuel 12:6
content: 6 Samuel said to the people, “It is the LORD who appointed Moses and Aaron, and that brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.

title: 1 Samuel 12:7
content: 7 Now therefore stand still, that I may plead with you before the LORD concerning all the righteous acts of the LORD, which he did to you and to your fathers.

title: 1 Samuel 12:8
content: 8 “When Jacob had come into Egypt, and your fathers cried to the LORD, then the LORD sent Moses and Aaron, who brought your fathers out of Egypt, and made them to dwell in this place.

title: 1 Samuel 12:9
content: 9 But they forgot the LORD their God; and he sold them into the hand of Sisera, captain of the army of Hazor, and into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the king of Moab; and they fought against them.

title: 1 Samuel 12:10
content: 10 They cried to the LORD, and said, ‘We have sinned, because we have forsaken the LORD and have served the Baals and the Ashtaroth; but now deliver us out of the hand of our enemies, and we will serve you.’

title: 1 Samuel 12:11
content: 11 The LORD sent Jerubbaal, Bedan, Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side; and you lived in safety.

title: 1 Samuel 12:12
content: 12 “When you saw that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon came against you, you said to me, ‘No, but a king shall reign over us,’ when the LORD your God was your king.

title: 1 Samuel 12:13
content: 13 Now therefore see the king whom you have chosen and whom you have asked for. Behold, the LORD has set a king over you.

title: 1 Samuel 12:14
content: 14 If you will fear the LORD, and serve him, and listen to his voice, and not rebel against the commandment of the LORD, then both you and also the king who reigns over you are followers of the LORD your God.

title: 1 Samuel 12:15
content: 15 But if you will not listen to the LORD’s voice, but rebel against the commandment of the LORD, then the LORD’s hand will be against you, as it was against your fathers.

title: 1 Samuel 12:16
content: 16 “Now therefore stand still and see this great thing, which the LORD will do before your eyes.

title: 1 Samuel 12:17
content: 17 Isn’t it wheat harvest today? I will call to the LORD, that he may send thunder and rain; and you will know and see that your wickedness is great, which you have done in the LORD’s sight, in asking for a king.”

title: 1 Samuel 12:18
content: 18 So Samuel called to the LORD, and the LORD sent thunder and rain that day. Then all the people greatly feared the LORD and Samuel.

title: 1 Samuel 12:19
content: 19 All the people said to Samuel, “Pray for your servants to the LORD your God, that we not die; for we have added to all our sins this evil, to ask for a king.”

title: 1 Samuel 12:20
content: 20 Samuel said to the people, “Don’t be afraid. You have indeed done all this evil; yet don’t turn away from following the LORD, but serve the LORD with all your heart.

title: 1 Samuel 12:21
content: 21 Don’t turn away to go after vain things which can’t profit or deliver, for they are vain.

title: 1 Samuel 12:22
content: 22 For the LORD will not forsake his people for his great name’s sake, because it has pleased the LORD to make you a people for himself.

title: 1 Samuel 12:23
content: 23 Moreover, as for me, far be it from me that I should sin against the LORD in ceasing to pray for you; but I will instruct you in the good and the right way.

title: 1 Samuel 12:24
content: 24 Only fear the LORD, and serve him in truth with all your heart; for consider what great things he has done for you.

title: 1 Samuel 12:25
content: 25 But if you keep doing evil, you will be consumed, both you and your king.”

title: 1 Samuel 13:1
content: 1 Saul was thirty years old when he became king, and he reigned over Israel forty-two years.

title: 1 Samuel 13:2
content: 2 Saul chose for himself three thousand men of Israel, of which two thousand were with Saul in Michmash and in the Mount of Bethel, and one thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin. He sent the rest of the people to their own tents.

title: 1 Samuel 13:3
content: 3 Jonathan struck the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba, and the Philistines heard of it. Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, “Let the Hebrews hear!”

title: 1 Samuel 13:4
content: 4 All Israel heard that Saul had struck the garrison of the Philistines, and also that Israel was considered an abomination to the Philistines. The people were gathered together after Saul to Gilgal.

title: 1 Samuel 13:5
content: 5 The Philistines assembled themselves together to fight with Israel: thirty thousand chariots, six thousand horsemen, and people as the sand which is on the seashore in multitude. They came up and encamped in Michmash, eastward of Beth Aven.

title: 1 Samuel 13:6
content: 6 When the men of Israel saw that they were in trouble (for the people were distressed), then the people hid themselves in caves, in thickets, in rocks, in tombs, and in pits.

title: 1 Samuel 13:7
content: 7 Now some of the Hebrews had gone over the Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead; but as for Saul, he was yet in Gilgal, and all the people followed him trembling.

title: 1 Samuel 13:8
content: 8 He stayed seven days, according to the time set by Samuel; but Samuel didn’t come to Gilgal, and the people were scattering from him.

title: 1 Samuel 13:9
content: 9 Saul said, “Bring the burnt offering to me here, and the peace offerings.” He offered the burnt offering.

title: 1 Samuel 13:10
content: 10 It came to pass that as soon as he had finished offering the burnt offering, behold, Samuel came; and Saul went out to meet him, that he might greet him.

title: 1 Samuel 13:11
content: 11 Samuel said, “What have you done?” Saul said, “Because I saw that the people were scattered from me, and that you didn’t come within the days appointed, and that the Philistines assembled themselves together at Michmash,

title: 1 Samuel 13:12
content: 12 therefore I said, ‘Now the Philistines will come down on me to Gilgal, and I haven’t entreated the favor of the LORD.’ I forced myself therefore, and offered the burnt offering.”

title: 1 Samuel 13:13
content: 13 Samuel said to Saul, “You have done foolishly. You have not kept the commandment of the LORD your God, which he commanded you; for now the LORD would have established your kingdom on Israel forever.

title: 1 Samuel 13:14
content: 14 But now your kingdom will not continue. The LORD has sought for himself a man after his own heart, and the LORD has appointed him to be prince over his people, because you have not kept that which the LORD commanded you.”

title: 1 Samuel 13:15
content: 15 Samuel arose, and went from Gilgal to Gibeah of Benjamin. Saul counted the people who were present with him, about six hundred men.

title: 1 Samuel 13:16
content: 16 Saul, and Jonathan his son, and the people who were present with them, stayed in Geba of Benjamin; but the Philistines encamped in Michmash.

title: 1 Samuel 13:17
content: 17 The raiders came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies: one company turned to the way that leads to Ophrah, to the land of Shual;

title: 1 Samuel 13:18
content: 18 another company turned the way to Beth Horon; and another company turned the way of the border that looks down on the valley of Zeboim toward the wilderness.

title: 1 Samuel 13:19
content: 19 Now there was no blacksmith found throughout all the land of Israel, for the Philistines said, “Lest the Hebrews make themselves swords or spears”;

title: 1 Samuel 13:20
content: 20 but all the Israelites went down to the Philistines, each man to sharpen his own plowshare, mattock, ax, and sickle.

title: 1 Samuel 13:21
content: 21 The price was one payim each to sharpen mattocks, plowshares, pitchforks, axes, and goads.

title: 1 Samuel 13:22
content: 22 So it came to pass in the day of battle that neither sword nor spear was found in the hand of any of the people who were with Saul and Jonathan; but Saul and Jonathan his son had them.

title: 1 Samuel 13:23
content: 23 The garrison of the Philistines went out to the pass of Michmash.

title: 1 Samuel 14:1
content: 1 Now it happened on a day that Jonathan the son of Saul said to the young man who bore his armor, “Come! Let’s go over to the Philistines’ garrison that is on the other side.” But he didn’t tell his father.

title: 1 Samuel 14:2
content: 2 Saul stayed in the uttermost part of Gibeah under the pomegranate tree which is in Migron; and the people who were with him were about six hundred men,

title: 1 Samuel 14:3
content: 3 including Ahijah the son of Ahitub, Ichabod’s brother, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eli the priest of the LORD in Shiloh, wearing an ephod. The people didn’t know that Jonathan was gone.

title: 1 Samuel 14:4
content: 4 Between the passes, by which Jonathan sought to go over to the Philistines’ garrison, there was a rocky crag on the one side and a rocky crag on the other side; and the name of the one was Bozez, and the name of the other Seneh.

title: 1 Samuel 14:5
content: 5 The one crag rose up on the north in front of Michmash, and the other on the south in front of Geba.

title: 1 Samuel 14:6
content: 6 Jonathan said to the young man who bore his armor, “Come! Let’s go over to the garrison of these uncircumcised. It may be that the LORD will work for us, for there is no restraint on the LORD to save by many or by few.”

title: 1 Samuel 14:7
content: 7 His armor bearer said to him, “Do all that is in your heart. Go, and behold, I am with you according to your heart.”

title: 1 Samuel 14:8
content: 8 Then Jonathan said, “Behold, we will pass over to the men, and we will reveal ourselves to them.

title: 1 Samuel 14:9
content: 9 If they say this to us, ‘Wait until we come to you!’ then we will stand still in our place and will not go up to them.

title: 1 Samuel 14:10
content: 10 But if they say this, ‘Come up to us!’ then we will go up, for the LORD has delivered them into our hand. This shall be the sign to us.”

title: 1 Samuel 14:11
content: 11 Both of them revealed themselves to the garrison of the Philistines; and the Philistines said, “Behold, the Hebrews are coming out of the holes where they had hidden themselves!”

title: 1 Samuel 14:12
content: 12 The men of the garrison answered Jonathan and his armor bearer, and said, “Come up to us, and we will show you something!” Jonathan said to his armor bearer, “Come up after me, for the LORD has delivered them into the hand of Israel.”

title: 1 Samuel 14:13
content: 13 Jonathan climbed up on his hands and on his feet, and his armor bearer after him, and they fell before Jonathan; and his armor bearer killed them after him.

title: 1 Samuel 14:14
content: 14 That first slaughter, which Jonathan and his armor bearer made, was about twenty men, within as it were half a furrow’s length in an acre of land.

title: 1 Samuel 14:15
content: 15 There was a trembling in the camp, in the field, and among all the people; the garrison and the raiders also trembled; and the earth quaked, so there was an exceedingly great trembling.

title: 1 Samuel 14:16
content: 16 The watchmen of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked; and behold, the multitude melted away and scattered.

title: 1 Samuel 14:17
content: 17 Then Saul said to the people who were with him, “Count now, and see who is missing from us.” When they had counted, behold, Jonathan and his armor bearer were not there.

title: 1 Samuel 14:18
content: 18 Saul said to Ahijah, “Bring God’s ark here.” For God’s ark was with the children of Israel at that time.

title: 1 Samuel 14:19
content: 19 While Saul talked to the priest, the tumult that was in the camp of the Philistines went on and increased; and Saul said to the priest, “Withdraw your hand!”

title: 1 Samuel 14:20
content: 20 Saul and all the people who were with him were gathered together, and came to the battle; and behold, they were all striking each other with their swords in very great confusion.

title: 1 Samuel 14:21
content: 21 Now the Hebrews who were with the Philistines before and who went up with them into the camp from all around, even they also turned to be with the Israelites who were with Saul and Jonathan.

title: 1 Samuel 14:22
content: 22 Likewise all the men of Israel who had hidden themselves in the hill country of Ephraim, when they heard that the Philistines fled, even they also followed hard after them in the battle.

title: 1 Samuel 14:23
content: 23 So the LORD saved Israel that day; and the battle passed over by Beth Aven.

title: 1 Samuel 14:24
content: 24 The men of Israel were distressed that day; for Saul had adjured the people, saying, “Cursed is the man who eats any food until it is evening, and I am avenged of my enemies.” So none of the people tasted food.

title: 1 Samuel 14:25
content: 25 All the people came into the forest; and there was honey on the ground.

title: 1 Samuel 14:26
content: 26 When the people had come to the forest, behold, honey was dripping, but no one put his hand to his mouth, for the people feared the oath.

title: 1 Samuel 14:27
content: 27 But Jonathan didn’t hear when his father commanded the people with the oath. Therefore he put out the end of the rod that was in his hand and dipped it in the honeycomb, and put his hand to his mouth; and his eyes brightened.

title: 1 Samuel 14:28
content: 28 Then one of the people answered, and said, “Your father directly commanded the people with an oath, saying, ‘Cursed is the man who eats food today.’” So the people were faint.

title: 1 Samuel 14:29
content: 29 Then Jonathan said, “My father has troubled the land. Please look how my eyes have brightened because I tasted a little of this honey.

title: 1 Samuel 14:30
content: 30 How much more, if perhaps the people had eaten freely today of the plunder of their enemies which they found? For now there has been no great slaughter among the Philistines.”

title: 1 Samuel 14:31
content: 31 They struck the Philistines that day from Michmash to Aijalon. The people were very faint;

title: 1 Samuel 14:32
content: 32 and the people pounced on the plunder, and took sheep, cattle, and calves, and killed them on the ground; and the people ate them with the blood.

title: 1 Samuel 14:33
content: 33 Then they told Saul, saying, “Behold, the people are sinning against the LORD, in that they eat meat with the blood.” He said, “You have dealt treacherously. Roll a large stone to me today!”

title: 1 Samuel 14:34
content: 34 Saul said, “Disperse yourselves among the people, and tell them, ‘Every man bring me here his ox, and every man his sheep, and kill them here, and eat; and don’t sin against the LORD in eating meat with the blood.’” All the people brought every man his ox with him that night, and killed them there.

title: 1 Samuel 14:35
content: 35 Saul built an altar to the LORD. This was the first altar that he built to the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 14:36
content: 36 Saul said, “Let’s go down after the Philistines by night, and take plunder among them until the morning light. Let’s not leave a man of them.” They said, “Do whatever seems good to you.” Then the priest said, “Let’s draw near here to God.”

title: 1 Samuel 14:37
content: 37 Saul asked counsel of God: “Shall I go down after the Philistines? Will you deliver them into the hand of Israel?” But he didn’t answer him that day.

title: 1 Samuel 14:38
content: 38 Saul said, “Draw near here, all you chiefs of the people, and know and see in whom this sin has been today.

title: 1 Samuel 14:39
content: 39 For as the LORD lives, who saves Israel, though it is in Jonathan my son, he shall surely die.” But there was not a man among all the people who answered him.

title: 1 Samuel 14:40
content: 40 Then he said to all Israel, “You be on one side, and I and Jonathan my son will be on the other side.” The people said to Saul, “Do what seems good to you.”

title: 1 Samuel 14:41
content: 41 Therefore Saul said to the LORD, the God of Israel, “Show the right.” Jonathan and Saul were chosen, but the people escaped.

title: 1 Samuel 14:42
content: 42 Saul said, “Cast lots between me and Jonathan my son.” Jonathan was selected.

title: 1 Samuel 14:43
content: 43 Then Saul said to Jonathan, “Tell me what you have done!” Jonathan told him, and said, “I certainly did taste a little honey with the end of the rod that was in my hand; and behold, I must die.”

title: 1 Samuel 14:44
content: 44 Saul said, “God do so and more also; for you shall surely die, Jonathan.”

title: 1 Samuel 14:45
content: 45 The people said to Saul, “Shall Jonathan die, who has worked this great salvation in Israel? Far from it! As the LORD lives, there shall not one hair of his head fall to the ground, for he has worked with God today!” So the people rescued Jonathan, so he didn’t die.

title: 1 Samuel 14:46
content: 46 Then Saul went up from following the Philistines; and the Philistines went to their own place.

title: 1 Samuel 14:47
content: 47 Now when Saul had taken the kingdom over Israel, he fought against all his enemies on every side: against Moab, and against the children of Ammon, and against Edom, and against the kings of Zobah, and against the Philistines. Wherever he turned himself, he defeated them.

title: 1 Samuel 14:48
content: 48 He did valiantly and struck the Amalekites, and delivered Israel out of the hands of those who plundered them.

title: 1 Samuel 14:49
content: 49 Now the sons of Saul were Jonathan, Ishvi, and Malchishua; and the names of his two daughters were these: the name of the firstborn Merab, and the name of the younger Michal.

title: 1 Samuel 14:50
content: 50 The name of Saul’s wife was Ahinoam the daughter of Ahimaaz. The name of the captain of his army was Abner the son of Ner, Saul’s uncle.

title: 1 Samuel 14:51
content: 51 Kish was the father of Saul, and Ner the father of Abner was the son of Abiel.

title: 1 Samuel 14:52
content: 52 There was severe war against the Philistines all the days of Saul; and when Saul saw any mighty man or any valiant man, he took him into his service.

title: 1 Samuel 15:1
content: 1 Samuel said to Saul, “The LORD sent me to anoint you to be king over his people, over Israel. Now therefore listen to the voice of the LORD’s words.

title: 1 Samuel 15:2
content: 2 The LORD of Armies says, ‘I remember what Amalek did to Israel, how he set himself against him on the way when he came up out of Egypt.

title: 1 Samuel 15:3
content: 3 Now go and strike Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and don’t spare them; but kill both man and woman, infant and nursing baby, ox and sheep, camel and donkey.’”

title: 1 Samuel 15:4
content: 4 Saul summoned the people, and counted them in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen and ten thousand men of Judah.

title: 1 Samuel 15:5
content: 5 Saul came to the city of Amalek, and set an ambush in the valley.

title: 1 Samuel 15:6
content: 6 Saul said to the Kenites, “Go, depart, go down from among the Amalekites, lest I destroy you with them; for you showed kindness to all the children of Israel when they came up out of Egypt.” So the Kenites departed from among the Amalekites.

title: 1 Samuel 15:7
content: 7 Saul struck the Amalekites, from Havilah as you go to Shur, which is before Egypt.

title: 1 Samuel 15:8
content: 8 He took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.

title: 1 Samuel 15:9
content: 9 But Saul and the people spared Agag and the best of the sheep, of the cattle, of the fat calves, of the lambs, and all that was good, and were not willing to utterly destroy them; but everything that was vile and refuse, that they destroyed utterly.

title: 1 Samuel 15:10
content: 10 Then the LORD’s word came to Samuel, saying,

title: 1 Samuel 15:11
content: 11 “It grieves me that I have set up Saul to be king, for he has turned back from following me, and has not performed my commandments.” Samuel was angry; and he cried to the LORD all night.

title: 1 Samuel 15:12
content: 12 Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning; and Samuel was told, saying, “Saul came to Carmel, and behold, he set up a monument for himself, turned, passed on, and went down to Gilgal.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:13
content: 13 Samuel came to Saul; and Saul said to him, “You are blessed by the LORD! I have performed the commandment of the LORD.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:14
content: 14 Samuel said, “Then what does this bleating of the sheep in my ears and the lowing of the cattle which I hear mean?”

title: 1 Samuel 15:15
content: 15 Saul said, “They have brought them from the Amalekites; for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the cattle, to sacrifice to the LORD your God. We have utterly destroyed the rest.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:16
content: 16 Then Samuel said to Saul, “Stay, and I will tell you what the LORD said to me last night.” He said to him, “Say on.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:17
content: 17 Samuel said, “Though you were little in your own sight, weren’t you made the head of the tribes of Israel? The LORD anointed you king over Israel;

title: 1 Samuel 15:18
content: 18 and the LORD sent you on a journey, and said, ‘Go, and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites, and fight against them until they are consumed.’

title: 1 Samuel 15:19
content: 19 Why then didn’t you obey the LORD’s voice, but took the plunder, and did that which was evil in the LORD’s sight?”

title: 1 Samuel 15:20
content: 20 Saul said to Samuel, “But I have obeyed the LORD’s voice, and have gone the way which the LORD sent me, and have brought Agag the king of Amalek, and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites.

title: 1 Samuel 15:21
content: 21 But the people took of the plunder, sheep and cattle, the best of the devoted things, to sacrifice to the LORD your God in Gilgal.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:22
content: 22 Samuel said, “Has the LORD as great delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices, as in obeying the LORD’s voice? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to listen than the fat of rams.

title: 1 Samuel 15:23
content: 23 For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubbornness is as idolatry and teraphim. Because you have rejected the LORD’s word, he has also rejected you from being king.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:24
content: 24 Saul said to Samuel, “I have sinned; for I have transgressed the commandment of the LORD and your words, because I feared the people and obeyed their voice.

title: 1 Samuel 15:25
content: 25 Now therefore, please pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship the LORD.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:26
content: 26 Samuel said to Saul, “I will not return with you; for you have rejected the LORD’s word, and the LORD has rejected you from being king over Israel.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:27
content: 27 As Samuel turned around to go away, Saul grabbed the skirt of his robe, and it tore.

title: 1 Samuel 15:28
content: 28 Samuel said to him, “The LORD has torn the kingdom of Israel from you today, and has given it to a neighbor of yours who is better than you.

title: 1 Samuel 15:29
content: 29 Also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor repent; for he is not a man, that he should repent.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:30
content: 30 Then he said, “I have sinned; yet please honor me now before the elders of my people and before Israel, and come back with me, that I may worship the LORD your God.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:31
content: 31 So Samuel went back with Saul; and Saul worshiped the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 15:32
content: 32 Then Samuel said, “Bring Agag the king of the Amalekites here to me!” Agag came to him cheerfully. Agag said, “Surely the bitterness of death is past.”

title: 1 Samuel 15:33
content: 33 Samuel said, “As your sword has made women childless, so your mother will be childless among women!” Then Samuel cut Agag in pieces before the LORD in Gilgal.

title: 1 Samuel 15:34
content: 34 Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeah of Saul.

title: 1 Samuel 15:35
content: 35 Samuel came no more to see Saul until the day of his death, but Samuel mourned for Saul. The LORD grieved that he had made Saul king over Israel.

title: 1 Samuel 16:1
content: 1 The LORD said to Samuel, “How long will you mourn for Saul, since I have rejected him from being king over Israel? Fill your horn with oil, and go. I will send you to Jesse the Bethlehemite, for I have provided a king for myself among his sons.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:2
content: 2 Samuel said, “How can I go? If Saul hears it, he will kill me.” The LORD said, “Take a heifer with you, and say, ‘I have come to sacrifice to the LORD.’

title: 1 Samuel 16:3
content: 3 Call Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will show you what you shall do. You shall anoint to me him whom I name to you.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:4
content: 4 Samuel did that which the LORD spoke, and came to Bethlehem. The elders of the city came to meet him trembling, and said, “Do you come peaceably?”

title: 1 Samuel 16:5
content: 5 He said, “Peaceably; I have come to sacrifice to the LORD. Sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice.” He sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice.

title: 1 Samuel 16:6
content: 6 When they had come, he looked at Eliab, and said, “Surely the LORD’s anointed is before him.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:7
content: 7 But the LORD said to Samuel, “Don’t look on his face, or on the height of his stature, because I have rejected him; for I don’t see as man sees. For man looks at the outward appearance, but the LORD looks at the heart.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:8
content: 8 Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel. He said, “The LORD has not chosen this one, either.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:9
content: 9 Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by. He said, “The LORD has not chosen this one, either.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:10
content: 10 Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. Samuel said to Jesse, “The LORD has not chosen these.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:11
content: 11 Samuel said to Jesse, “Are all your children here?” He said, “There remains yet the youngest. Behold, he is keeping the sheep.” Samuel said to Jesse, “Send and get him, for we will not sit down until he comes here.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:12
content: 12 He sent, and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, with a handsome face and good appearance. The LORD said, “Arise! Anoint him, for this is he.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:13
content: 13 Then Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the middle of his brothers. Then the LORD’s Spirit came mightily on David from that day forward. So Samuel rose up and went to Ramah.

title: 1 Samuel 16:14
content: 14 Now the LORD’s Spirit departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from the LORD troubled him.

title: 1 Samuel 16:15
content: 15 Saul’s servants said to him, “See now, an evil spirit from God troubles you.

title: 1 Samuel 16:16
content: 16 Let our lord now command your servants who are in front of you to seek out a man who is a skillful player on the harp. Then when the evil spirit from God is on you, he will play with his hand, and you will be well.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:17
content: 17 Saul said to his servants, “Provide me now a man who can play well, and bring him to me.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:18
content: 18 Then one of the young men answered and said, “Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite who is skillful in playing, a mighty man of valor, a man of war, prudent in speech, and a handsome person; and the LORD is with him.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:19
content: 19 Therefore Saul sent messengers to Jesse, and said, “Send me David your son, who is with the sheep.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:20
content: 20 Jesse took a donkey loaded with bread, a container of wine, and a young goat, and sent them by David his son to Saul.

title: 1 Samuel 16:21
content: 21 David came to Saul and stood before him. He loved him greatly; and he became his armor bearer.

title: 1 Samuel 16:22
content: 22 Saul sent to Jesse, saying, “Please let David stand before me, for he has found favor in my sight.”

title: 1 Samuel 16:23
content: 23 When the spirit from God was on Saul, David took the harp and played with his hand; so Saul was refreshed and was well, and the evil spirit departed from him.

title: 1 Samuel 17:1
content: 1 Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle; and they were gathered together at Socoh, which belongs to Judah, and encamped between Socoh and Azekah in Ephesdammim.

title: 1 Samuel 17:2
content: 2 Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and encamped in the valley of Elah, and set the battle in array against the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel 17:3
content: 3 The Philistines stood on the mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on the mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.

title: 1 Samuel 17:4
content: 4 A champion out of the camp of the Philistines named Goliath of Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span went out.

title: 1 Samuel 17:5
content: 5 He had a helmet of bronze on his head, and he wore a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of bronze.

title: 1 Samuel 17:6
content: 6 He had bronze shin armor on his legs and a bronze javelin between his shoulders.

title: 1 Samuel 17:7
content: 7 The staff of his spear was like a weaver’s beam; and his spear’s head weighed six hundred shekels of iron. His shield bearer went before him.

title: 1 Samuel 17:8
content: 8 He stood and cried to the armies of Israel, and said to them, “Why have you come out to set your battle in array? Am I not a Philistine, and you servants to Saul? Choose a man for yourselves, and let him come down to me.

title: 1 Samuel 17:9
content: 9 If he is able to fight with me and kill me, then will we be your servants; but if I prevail against him and kill him, then you will be our servants and serve us.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:10
content: 10 The Philistine said, “I defy the armies of Israel today! Give me a man, that we may fight together!”

title: 1 Samuel 17:11
content: 11 When Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed and greatly afraid.

title: 1 Samuel 17:12
content: 12 Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehem Judah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons. The man was an elderly old man in the days of Saul.

title: 1 Samuel 17:13
content: 13 The three oldest sons of Jesse had gone after Saul to the battle; and the names of his three sons who went to the battle were Eliab the firstborn, and next to him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.

title: 1 Samuel 17:14
content: 14 David was the youngest; and the three oldest followed Saul.

title: 1 Samuel 17:15
content: 15 Now David went back and forth from Saul to feed his father’s sheep at Bethlehem.

title: 1 Samuel 17:16
content: 16 The Philistine came near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days.

title: 1 Samuel 17:17
content: 17 Jesse said to David his son, “Now take for your brothers an ephah of this parched grain and these ten loaves, and carry them quickly to the camp to your brothers;

title: 1 Samuel 17:18
content: 18 and bring these ten cheeses to the captain of their thousand; and see how your brothers are doing, and bring back news.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:19
content: 19 Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel were in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel 17:20
content: 20 David rose up early in the morning and left the sheep with a keeper, and took the provisions and went, as Jesse had commanded him. He came to the place of the wagons as the army which was going out to the fight shouted for the battle.

title: 1 Samuel 17:21
content: 21 Israel and the Philistines put the battle in array, army against army.

title: 1 Samuel 17:22
content: 22 David left his baggage in the hand of the keeper of the baggage and ran to the army, and came and greeted his brothers.

title: 1 Samuel 17:23
content: 23 As he talked with them, behold, the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, came up out of the ranks of the Philistines, and said the same words; and David heard them.

title: 1 Samuel 17:24
content: 24 All the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him and were terrified.

title: 1 Samuel 17:25
content: 25 The men of Israel said, “Have you seen this man who has come up? He has surely come up to defy Israel. The king will give great riches to the man who kills him, and will give him his daughter, and will make his father’s house tax-free in Israel.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:26
content: 26 David spoke to the men who stood by him, saying, “What shall be done to the man who kills this Philistine and takes away the reproach from Israel? For who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?”

title: 1 Samuel 17:27
content: 27 The people answered him in this way, saying, “So shall it be done to the man who kills him.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:28
