content: 28 Eliab his oldest brother heard when he spoke to the men; and Eliab’s anger burned against David, and he said, “Why have you come down? With whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your pride and the evil of your heart; for you have come down that you might see the battle.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:29
content: 29 David said, “What have I now done? Is there not a cause?”

title: 1 Samuel 17:30
content: 30 He turned away from him toward another, and spoke like that again; and the people answered him again the same way.

title: 1 Samuel 17:31
content: 31 When the words were heard which David spoke, they rehearsed them before Saul; and he sent for him.

title: 1 Samuel 17:32
content: 32 David said to Saul, “Let no man’s heart fail because of him. Your servant will go and fight with this Philistine.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:33
content: 33 Saul said to David, “You are not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him; for you are but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:34
content: 34 David said to Saul, “Your servant was keeping his father’s sheep; and when a lion or a bear came and took a lamb out of the flock,

title: 1 Samuel 17:35
content: 35 I went out after him, struck him, and rescued it out of his mouth. When he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, struck him, and killed him.

title: 1 Samuel 17:36
content: 36 Your servant struck both the lion and the bear. This uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, since he has defied the armies of the living God.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:37
content: 37 David said, “The LORD, who delivered me out of the paw of the lion and out of the paw of the bear, will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine.” Saul said to David, “Go! The LORD will be with you.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:38
content: 38 Saul dressed David with his clothing. He put a helmet of bronze on his head, and he clad him with a coat of mail.

title: 1 Samuel 17:39
content: 39 David strapped his sword on his clothing and he tried to move, for he had not tested it. David said to Saul, “I can’t go with these, for I have not tested them.” Then David took them off.

title: 1 Samuel 17:40
content: 40 He took his staff in his hand, and chose for himself five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in the pouch of his shepherd’s bag which he had. His sling was in his hand; and he came near to the Philistine.

title: 1 Samuel 17:41
content: 41 The Philistine walked and came near to David; and the man who bore the shield went before him.

title: 1 Samuel 17:42
content: 42 When the Philistine looked around and saw David, he disdained him; for he was but a youth, and ruddy, and had a good looking face.

title: 1 Samuel 17:43
content: 43 The Philistine said to David, “Am I a dog, that you come to me with sticks?” The Philistine cursed David by his gods.

title: 1 Samuel 17:44
content: 44 The Philistine said to David, “Come to me, and I will give your flesh to the birds of the sky and to the animals of the field.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:45
content: 45 Then David said to the Philistine, “You come to me with a sword, with a spear, and with a javelin; but I come to you in the name of the LORD of Armies, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied.

title: 1 Samuel 17:46
content: 46 Today, the LORD will deliver you into my hand. I will strike you and take your head from off you. I will give the dead bodies of the army of the Philistines today to the birds of the sky and to the wild animals of the earth, that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel,

title: 1 Samuel 17:47
content: 47 and that all this assembly may know that the LORD doesn’t save with sword and spear; for the battle is the LORD’s, and he will give you into our hand.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:48
content: 48 When the Philistine arose, and walked and came near to meet David, David hurried and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.

title: 1 Samuel 17:49
content: 49 David put his hand in his bag, took a stone and slung it, and struck the Philistine in his forehead. The stone sank into his forehead, and he fell on his face to the earth.

title: 1 Samuel 17:50
content: 50 So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and struck the Philistine and killed him; but there was no sword in David’s hand.

title: 1 Samuel 17:51
content: 51 Then David ran, stood over the Philistine, took his sword, drew it out of its sheath, killed him, and cut off his head with it. When the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they fled.

title: 1 Samuel 17:52
content: 52 The men of Israel and of Judah arose and shouted, and pursued the Philistines as far as Gai and to the gates of Ekron. The wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even to Gath and to Ekron.

title: 1 Samuel 17:53
content: 53 The children of Israel returned from chasing after the Philistines, and they plundered their camp.

title: 1 Samuel 17:54
content: 54 David took the head of the Philistine and brought it to Jerusalem, but he put his armor in his tent.

title: 1 Samuel 17:55
content: 55 When Saul saw David go out against the Philistine, he said to Abner, the captain of the army, “Abner, whose son is this youth?” Abner said, “As your soul lives, O king, I can’t tell.”

title: 1 Samuel 17:56
content: 56 The king said, “Inquire whose son the young man is!”

title: 1 Samuel 17:57
content: 57 As David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took him and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.

title: 1 Samuel 17:58
content: 58 Saul said to him, “Whose son are you, you young man?” David answered, “I am the son of your servant Jesse the Bethlehemite.”

title: 1 Samuel 18:1
content: 1 When he had finished speaking to Saul, the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul.

title: 1 Samuel 18:2
content: 2 Saul took him that day, and wouldn’t let him go home to his father’s house any more.

title: 1 Samuel 18:3
content: 3 Then Jonathan and David made a covenant, because he loved him as his own soul.

title: 1 Samuel 18:4
content: 4 Jonathan stripped himself of the robe that was on him and gave it to David with his clothing, even including his sword, his bow, and his sash.

title: 1 Samuel 18:5
content: 5 David went out wherever Saul sent him, and behaved himself wisely; and Saul set him over the men of war. It was good in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of Saul’s servants.

title: 1 Samuel 18:6
content: 6 As they came, when David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, the women came out of all the cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet King Saul with tambourines, with joy, and with instruments of music.

title: 1 Samuel 18:7
content: 7 The women sang to one another as they played, and said, “Saul has slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands.”

title: 1 Samuel 18:8
content: 8 Saul was very angry, and this saying displeased him. He said, “They have credited David with ten thousands, and they have only credited me with thousands. What can he have more but the kingdom?”

title: 1 Samuel 18:9
content: 9 Saul watched David from that day and forward.

title: 1 Samuel 18:10
content: 10 On the next day, an evil spirit from God came mightily on Saul, and he prophesied in the middle of the house. David played with his hand, as he did day by day. Saul had his spear in his hand;

title: 1 Samuel 18:11
content: 11 and Saul threw the spear, for he said, “I will pin David to the wall!” David escaped from his presence twice.

title: 1 Samuel 18:12
content: 12 Saul was afraid of David, because the LORD was with him, and had departed from Saul.

title: 1 Samuel 18:13
content: 13 Therefore Saul removed him from his presence, and made him his captain over a thousand; and he went out and came in before the people.

title: 1 Samuel 18:14
content: 14 David behaved himself wisely in all his ways; and the LORD was with him.

title: 1 Samuel 18:15
content: 15 When Saul saw that he behaved himself very wisely, he stood in awe of him.

title: 1 Samuel 18:16
content: 16 But all Israel and Judah loved David; for he went out and came in before them.

title: 1 Samuel 18:17
content: 17 Saul said to David, “Behold, my elder daughter Merab. I will give her to you as wife. Only be valiant for me, and fight the LORD’s battles.” For Saul said, “Don’t let my hand be on him, but let the hand of the Philistines be on him.”

title: 1 Samuel 18:18
content: 18 David said to Saul, “Who am I, and what is my life, or my father’s family in Israel, that I should be son-in-law to the king?”

title: 1 Samuel 18:19
content: 19 But at the time when Merab, Saul’s daughter, should have been given to David, she was given to Adriel the Meholathite as wife.

title: 1 Samuel 18:20
content: 20 Michal, Saul’s daughter, loved David; and they told Saul, and the thing pleased him.

title: 1 Samuel 18:21
content: 21 Saul said, I will give her to him, that she may be a snare to him and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him. Therefore Saul said to David a second time, “You shall today be my son-in-law.”

title: 1 Samuel 18:22
content: 22 Saul commanded his servants, “Talk with David secretly, and say, ‘Behold, the king has delight in you, and all his servants love you. Now therefore be the king’s son-in-law.’”

title: 1 Samuel 18:23
content: 23 Saul’s servants spoke those words in the ears of David. David said, “Does it seem to you a light thing to be the king’s son-in-law, since I am a poor man and little known?”

title: 1 Samuel 18:24
content: 24 The servants of Saul told him, saying, “David spoke like this.”

title: 1 Samuel 18:25
content: 25 Saul said, “Tell David, ‘The king desires no dowry except one hundred foreskins of the Philistines, to be avenged of the king’s enemies.’” Now Saul thought he would make David fall by the hand of the Philistines.

title: 1 Samuel 18:26
content: 26 When his servants told David these words, it pleased David well to be the king’s son-in-law. Before the deadline,

title: 1 Samuel 18:27
content: 27 David arose and went, he and his men, and killed two hundred men of the Philistines. Then David brought their foreskins, and they gave them in full number to the king, that he might be the king’s son-in-law. Then Saul gave him Michal his daughter as wife.

title: 1 Samuel 18:28
content: 28 Saul saw and knew that the LORD was with David; and Michal, Saul’s daughter, loved him.

title: 1 Samuel 18:29
content: 29 Saul was even more afraid of David; and Saul was David’s enemy continually.

title: 1 Samuel 18:30
content: 30 Then the princes of the Philistines went out; and as often as they went out, David behaved himself more wisely than all the servants of Saul, so that his name was highly esteemed.

title: 1 Samuel 19:1
content: 1 Saul spoke to Jonathan his son and to all his servants, that they should kill David. But Jonathan, Saul’s son, greatly delighted in David.

title: 1 Samuel 19:2
content: 2 Jonathan told David, saying, “Saul my father seeks to kill you. Now therefore, please take care of yourself in the morning, live in a secret place, and hide yourself.

title: 1 Samuel 19:3
content: 3 I will go out and stand beside my father in the field where you are, and I will talk with my father about you; and if I see anything, I will tell you.”

title: 1 Samuel 19:4
content: 4 Jonathan spoke good of David to Saul his father, and said to him, “Don’t let the king sin against his servant, against David; because he has not sinned against you, and because his works have been very good toward you;

title: 1 Samuel 19:5
content: 5 for he put his life in his hand and struck the Philistine, and the LORD worked a great victory for all Israel. You saw it and rejoiced. Why then will you sin against innocent blood, to kill David without a cause?”

title: 1 Samuel 19:6
content: 6 Saul listened to the voice of Jonathan; and Saul swore, “As the LORD lives, he shall not be put to death.”

title: 1 Samuel 19:7
content: 7 Jonathan called David, and Jonathan showed him all those things. Then Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence as before.

title: 1 Samuel 19:8
content: 8 There was war again. David went out and fought with the Philistines, and killed them with a great slaughter; and they fled before him.

title: 1 Samuel 19:9
content: 9 An evil spirit from the LORD was on Saul as he sat in his house with his spear in his hand; and David was playing music with his hand.

title: 1 Samuel 19:10
content: 10 Saul sought to pin David to the wall with the spear, but he slipped away out of Saul’s presence; and he stuck the spear into the wall. David fled and escaped that night.

title: 1 Samuel 19:11
content: 11 Saul sent messengers to David’s house to watch him and to kill him in the morning. Michal, David’s wife, told him, saying, “If you don’t save your life tonight, tomorrow you will be killed.”

title: 1 Samuel 19:12
content: 12 So Michal let David down through the window. He went away, fled, and escaped.

title: 1 Samuel 19:13
content: 13 Michal took the teraphim and laid it in the bed, and put a pillow of goats’ hair at its head and covered it with clothes.

title: 1 Samuel 19:14
content: 14 When Saul sent messengers to take David, she said, “He is sick.”

title: 1 Samuel 19:15
content: 15 Saul sent the messengers to see David, saying, “Bring him up to me in the bed, that I may kill him.”

title: 1 Samuel 19:16
content: 16 When the messengers came in, behold, the teraphim was in the bed, with the pillow of goats’ hair at its head.

title: 1 Samuel 19:17
content: 17 Saul said to Michal, “Why have you deceived me like this and let my enemy go, so that he has escaped?” Michal answered Saul, “He said to me, ‘Let me go! Why should I kill you?’”

title: 1 Samuel 19:18
content: 18 Now David fled and escaped, and came to Samuel at Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him. He and Samuel went and lived in Naioth.

title: 1 Samuel 19:19
content: 19 Saul was told, saying, “Behold, David is at Naioth in Ramah.”

title: 1 Samuel 19:20
content: 20 Saul sent messengers to seize David; and when they saw the company of the prophets prophesying, and Samuel standing as head over them, God’s Spirit came on Saul’s messengers, and they also prophesied.

title: 1 Samuel 19:21
content: 21 When Saul was told, he sent other messengers, and they also prophesied. Saul sent messengers again the third time, and they also prophesied.

title: 1 Samuel 19:22
content: 22 Then he also went to Ramah, and came to the great well that is in Secu: and he asked, “Where are Samuel and David?” One said, “Behold, they are at Naioth in Ramah.”

title: 1 Samuel 19:23
content: 23 He went there to Naioth in Ramah. Then God’s Spirit came on him also, and he went on, and prophesied, until he came to Naioth in Ramah.

title: 1 Samuel 19:24
content: 24 He also stripped off his clothes. He also prophesied before Samuel and lay down naked all that day and all that night. Therefore they say, “Is Saul also among the prophets?”

title: 1 Samuel 20:1
content: 1 David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said to Jonathan, “What have I done? What is my iniquity? What is my sin before your father, that he seeks my life?”

title: 1 Samuel 20:2
content: 2 He said to him, “Far from it; you will not die. Behold, my father does nothing either great or small, but that he discloses it to me. Why would my father hide this thing from me? It is not so.”

title: 1 Samuel 20:3
content: 3 David swore moreover, and said, “Your father knows well that I have found favor in your eyes; and he says, ‘Don’t let Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved;’ but truly as the LORD lives, and as your soul lives, there is but a step between me and death.”

title: 1 Samuel 20:4
content: 4 Then Jonathan said to David, “Whatever your soul desires, I will even do it for you.”

title: 1 Samuel 20:5
content: 5 David said to Jonathan, “Behold, tomorrow is the new moon, and I should not fail to dine with the king; but let me go, that I may hide myself in the field to the third day at evening.

title: 1 Samuel 20:6
content: 6 If your father misses me at all, then say, ‘David earnestly asked leave of me that he might run to Bethlehem, his city; for it is the yearly sacrifice there for all the family.’

title: 1 Samuel 20:7
content: 7 If he says, ‘It is well,’ your servant shall have peace; but if he is angry, then know that evil is determined by him.

title: 1 Samuel 20:8
content: 8 Therefore deal kindly with your servant, for you have brought your servant into a covenant of the LORD with you; but if there is iniquity in me, kill me yourself, for why should you bring me to your father?”

title: 1 Samuel 20:9
content: 9 Jonathan said, “Far be it from you; for if I should at all know that evil were determined by my father to come on you, then wouldn’t I tell you that?”

title: 1 Samuel 20:10
content: 10 Then David said to Jonathan, “Who will tell me if your father answers you roughly?”

title: 1 Samuel 20:11
content: 11 Jonathan said to David, “Come! Let’s go out into the field.” They both went out into the field.

title: 1 Samuel 20:12
content: 12 Jonathan said to David, “By the LORD, the God of Israel, when I have sounded out my father about this time tomorrow, or the third day, behold, if there is good toward David, won’t I then send to you and disclose it to you?

title: 1 Samuel 20:13
content: 13 The LORD do so to Jonathan and more also, should it please my father to do you evil, if I don’t disclose it to you and send you away, that you may go in peace. May the LORD be with you as he has been with my father.

title: 1 Samuel 20:14
content: 14 You shall not only show me the loving kindness of the LORD while I still live, that I not die;

title: 1 Samuel 20:15
content: 15 but you shall also not cut off your kindness from my house forever, no, not when the LORD has cut off every one of the enemies of David from the surface of the earth.”

title: 1 Samuel 20:16
content: 16 So Jonathan made a covenant with David’s house, saying, “The LORD will require it at the hand of David’s enemies.”

title: 1 Samuel 20:17
content: 17 Jonathan caused David to swear again, for the love that he had to him; for he loved him as he loved his own soul.

title: 1 Samuel 20:18
content: 18 Then Jonathan said to him, “Tomorrow is the new moon, and you will be missed, because your seat will be empty.

title: 1 Samuel 20:19
content: 19 When you have stayed three days, go down quickly and come to the place where you hid yourself when this started, and remain by the stone Ezel.

title: 1 Samuel 20:20
content: 20 I will shoot three arrows on its side, as though I shot at a mark.

title: 1 Samuel 20:21
content: 21 Behold, I will send the boy, saying, ‘Go, find the arrows!’ If I tell the boy, ‘Behold, the arrows are on this side of you. Take them;’ then come, for there is peace to you and no danger, as the LORD lives.

title: 1 Samuel 20:22
content: 22 But if I say this to the boy, ‘Behold, the arrows are beyond you,’ then go your way, for the LORD has sent you away.

title: 1 Samuel 20:23
content: 23 Concerning the matter which you and I have spoken of, behold, the LORD is between you and me forever.”

title: 1 Samuel 20:24
content: 24 So David hid himself in the field. When the new moon had come, the king sat himself down to eat food.

title: 1 Samuel 20:25
content: 25 The king sat on his seat, as at other times, even on the seat by the wall; and Jonathan stood up, and Abner sat by Saul’s side, but David’s place was empty.

title: 1 Samuel 20:26
content: 26 Nevertheless Saul didn’t say anything that day, for he thought, “Something has happened to him. He is not clean. Surely he is not clean.”

title: 1 Samuel 20:27
content: 27 On the next day after the new moon, the second day, David’s place was empty. Saul said to Jonathan his son, “Why didn’t the son of Jesse come to eat, either yesterday, or today?”

title: 1 Samuel 20:28
content: 28 Jonathan answered Saul, “David earnestly asked permission of me to go to Bethlehem.

title: 1 Samuel 20:29
content: 29 He said, ‘Please let me go, for our family has a sacrifice in the city. My brother has commanded me to be there. Now, if I have found favor in your eyes, please let me go away and see my brothers.’ Therefore he has not come to the king’s table.”

title: 1 Samuel 20:30
content: 30 Then Saul’s anger burned against Jonathan, and he said to him, “You son of a perverse rebellious woman, don’t I know that you have chosen the son of Jesse to your own shame, and to the shame of your mother’s nakedness?

title: 1 Samuel 20:31
content: 31 For as long as the son of Jesse lives on the earth, you will not be established, nor will your kingdom. Therefore now send and bring him to me, for he shall surely die!”

title: 1 Samuel 20:32
content: 32 Jonathan answered Saul his father, and said to him, “Why should he be put to death? What has he done?”

title: 1 Samuel 20:33
content: 33 Saul cast his spear at him to strike him. By this Jonathan knew that his father was determined to put David to death.

title: 1 Samuel 20:34
content: 34 So Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger, and ate no food the second day of the month; for he was grieved for David, because his father had treated him shamefully.

title: 1 Samuel 20:35
content: 35 In the morning, Jonathan went out into the field at the time appointed with David, and a little boy with him.

title: 1 Samuel 20:36
content: 36 He said to his boy, “Run, find now the arrows which I shoot.” As the boy ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.

title: 1 Samuel 20:37
content: 37 When the boy had come to the place of the arrow which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried after the boy, and said, “Isn’t the arrow beyond you?”

title: 1 Samuel 20:38
content: 38 Jonathan cried after the boy, “Go fast! Hurry! Don’t delay!” Jonathan’s boy gathered up the arrows, and came to his master.

title: 1 Samuel 20:39
content: 39 But the boy didn’t know anything. Only Jonathan and David knew the matter.

title: 1 Samuel 20:40
content: 40 Jonathan gave his weapons to his boy, and said to him, “Go, carry them to the city.”

title: 1 Samuel 20:41
content: 41 As soon as the boy was gone, David arose out of the south, and fell on his face to the ground, and bowed himself three times. They kissed one another and wept with one another, and David wept the most.

title: 1 Samuel 20:42
content: 42 Jonathan said to David, “Go in peace, because we have both sworn in the LORD’s name, saying, ‘The LORD is between me and you, and between my offspring and your offspring, forever.’” He arose and departed; and Jonathan went into the city.

title: 1 Samuel 21:1
content: 1 Then David came to Nob to Ahimelech the priest. Ahimelech came to meet David trembling, and said to him, “Why are you alone, and no man with you?”

title: 1 Samuel 21:2
content: 2 David said to Ahimelech the priest, “The king has commanded me to do something, and has said to me, ‘Let no one know anything about the business about which I send you, and what I have commanded you. I have sent the young men to a certain place.’

title: 1 Samuel 21:3
content: 3 Now therefore what is under your hand? Please give me five loaves of bread in my hand, or whatever is available.”

title: 1 Samuel 21:4
content: 4 The priest answered David, and said, “I have no common bread, but there is holy bread; if only the young men have kept themselves from women.”

title: 1 Samuel 21:5
content: 5 David answered the priest, and said to him, “Truly, women have been kept from us as usual these three days. When I came out, the vessels of the young men were holy, though it was only a common journey. How much more then today shall their vessels be holy?”

title: 1 Samuel 21:6
content: 6 So the priest gave him holy bread; for there was no bread there but the show bread that was taken from before the LORD, to be replaced with hot bread in the day when it was taken away.

title: 1 Samuel 21:7
content: 7 Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before the LORD; and his name was Doeg the Edomite, the best of the herdsmen who belonged to Saul.

title: 1 Samuel 21:8
content: 8 David said to Ahimelech, “Isn’t there here under your hand spear or sword? For I haven’t brought my sword or my weapons with me, because the king’s business required haste.”

title: 1 Samuel 21:9
content: 9 The priest said, “Behold, the sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom you killed in the valley of Elah, is here wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod. If you would like to take that, take it, for there is no other except that here.” David said, “There is none like that. Give it to me.”

title: 1 Samuel 21:10
content: 10 David arose and fled that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish the king of Gath.

title: 1 Samuel 21:11
content: 11 The servants of Achish said to him, “Isn’t this David the king of the land? Didn’t they sing to one another about him in dances, saying, ‘Saul has slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands’?”

title: 1 Samuel 21:12
content: 12 David laid up these words in his heart, and was very afraid of Achish the king of Gath.

title: 1 Samuel 21:13
content: 13 He changed his behavior before them and pretended to be insane in their hands, and scribbled on the doors of the gate, and let his spittle fall down on his beard.

title: 1 Samuel 21:14
content: 14 Then Achish said to his servants, “Look, you see the man is insane. Why then have you brought him to me?

title: 1 Samuel 21:15
content: 15 Do I lack madmen, that you have brought this fellow to play the madman in my presence? Should this fellow come into my house?”

title: 1 Samuel 22:1
content: 1 David therefore departed from there and escaped to Adullam’s cave. When his brothers and all his father’s house heard it, they went down there to him.

title: 1 Samuel 22:2
content: 2 Everyone who was in distress, everyone who was in debt, and everyone who was discontented gathered themselves to him; and he became captain over them. There were with him about four hundred men.

title: 1 Samuel 22:3
content: 3 David went from there to Mizpeh of Moab; and he said to the king of Moab, “Please let my father and my mother come out to you, until I know what God will do for me.”

title: 1 Samuel 22:4
content: 4 He brought them before the king of Moab; and they lived with him all the time that David was in the stronghold.

title: 1 Samuel 22:5
content: 5 The prophet Gad said to David, “Don’t stay in the stronghold. Depart, and go into the land of Judah.” Then David departed, and came into the forest of Hereth.

title: 1 Samuel 22:6
content: 6 Saul heard that David was discovered, with the men who were with him. Now Saul was sitting in Gibeah, under the tamarisk tree in Ramah, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants were standing around him.

title: 1 Samuel 22:7
content: 7 Saul said to his servants who stood around him, “Hear now, you Benjamites! Will the son of Jesse give everyone of you fields and vineyards? Will he make you all captains of thousands and captains of hundreds?

title: 1 Samuel 22:8
content: 8 Is that why all of you have conspired against me, and there is no one who discloses to me when my son makes a treaty with the son of Jesse, and there is none of you who is sorry for me, or discloses to me that my son has stirred up my servant against me, to lie in wait, as it is today?”

title: 1 Samuel 22:9
content: 9 Then Doeg the Edomite, who stood by the servants of Saul, answered and said, “I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech the son of Ahitub.

title: 1 Samuel 22:10
content: 10 He inquired of the LORD for him, gave him food, and gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.”

title: 1 Samuel 22:11
content: 11 Then the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and all his father’s house, the priests who were in Nob; and they all came to the king.

title: 1 Samuel 22:12
content: 12 Saul said, “Hear now, you son of Ahitub.” He answered, “Here I am, my lord.”

title: 1 Samuel 22:13
content: 13 Saul said to him, “Why have you conspired against me, you and the son of Jesse, in that you have given him bread, and a sword, and have inquired of God for him, that he should rise against me, to lie in wait, as it is today?”

title: 1 Samuel 22:14
content: 14 Then Ahimelech answered the king, and said, “Who among all your servants is so faithful as David, who is the king’s son-in-law, captain of your body guard, and honored in your house?

title: 1 Samuel 22:15
content: 15 Have I today begun to inquire of God for him? Be it far from me! Don’t let the king impute anything to his servant, nor to all the house of my father; for your servant knew nothing of all this, less or more.”

title: 1 Samuel 22:16
content: 16 The king said, “You shall surely die, Ahimelech, you and all your father’s house.”

title: 1 Samuel 22:17
content: 17 The king said to the guard who stood about him, “Turn and kill the priests of the LORD, because their hand also is with David, and because they knew that he fled and didn’t disclose it to me.” But the servants of the king wouldn’t put out their hand to fall on the priests of the LORD.

title: 1 Samuel 22:18
content: 18 The king said to Doeg, “Turn and attack the priests!” Doeg the Edomite turned, and he attacked the priests, and he killed on that day eighty-five people who wore a linen ephod.

title: 1 Samuel 22:19
content: 19 He struck Nob, the city of the priests, with the edge of the sword—both men and women, children and nursing babies, and cattle, donkeys, and sheep, with the edge of the sword.

title: 1 Samuel 22:20
content: 20 One of the sons of Ahimelech the son of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped and fled after David.

title: 1 Samuel 22:21
content: 21 Abiathar told David that Saul had slain the LORD’s priests.

title: 1 Samuel 22:22
content: 22 David said to Abiathar, “I knew on that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul. I am responsible for the death of all the persons of your father’s house.

title: 1 Samuel 22:23
content: 23 Stay with me. Don’t be afraid, for he who seeks my life seeks your life. You will be safe with me.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:1
content: 1 David was told, “Behold, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and are robbing the threshing floors.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:2
content: 2 Therefore David inquired of the LORD, saying, “Shall I go and strike these Philistines?” The LORD said to David, “Go strike the Philistines, and save Keilah.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:3
content: 3 David’s men said to him, “Behold, we are afraid here in Judah. How much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?”

title: 1 Samuel 23:4
content: 4 Then David inquired of the LORD yet again. The LORD answered him, and said, “Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver the Philistines into your hand.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:5
content: 5 David and his men went to Keilah and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their livestock, and killed them with a great slaughter. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.

title: 1 Samuel 23:6
content: 6 When Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, he came down with an ephod in his hand.

title: 1 Samuel 23:7
content: 7 Saul was told that David had come to Keilah. Saul said, “God has delivered him into my hand, for he is shut in by entering into a town that has gates and bars.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:8
content: 8 Saul summoned all the people to war, to go down to Keilah to besiege David and his men.

title: 1 Samuel 23:9
content: 9 David knew that Saul was devising mischief against him. He said to Abiathar the priest, “Bring the ephod here.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:10
content: 10 Then David said, “O LORD, the God of Israel, your servant has surely heard that Saul seeks to come to Keilah to destroy the city for my sake.

title: 1 Samuel 23:11
content: 11 Will the men of Keilah deliver me up into his hand? Will Saul come down, as your servant has heard? LORD, the God of Israel, I beg you, tell your servant.” The LORD said, “He will come down.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:12
content: 12 Then David said, “Will the men of Keilah deliver me and my men into the hand of Saul?” The LORD said, “They will deliver you up.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:13
content: 13 Then David and his men, who were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah and went wherever they could go. Saul was told that David had escaped from Keilah; and he gave up going there.

title: 1 Samuel 23:14
content: 14 David stayed in the wilderness in the strongholds, and remained in the hill country in the wilderness of Ziph. Saul sought him every day, but God didn’t deliver him into his hand.

title: 1 Samuel 23:15
content: 15 David saw that Saul had come out to seek his life. David was in the wilderness of Ziph in the woods.

title: 1 Samuel 23:16
content: 16 Jonathan, Saul’s son, arose and went to David into the woods, and strengthened his hand in God.

title: 1 Samuel 23:17
content: 17 He said to him, “Don’t be afraid, for the hand of Saul my father won’t find you; and you will be king over Israel, and I will be next to you; and Saul my father knows that also.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:18
content: 18 They both made a covenant before the LORD. Then David stayed in the woods and Jonathan went to his house.

title: 1 Samuel 23:19
content: 19 Then the Ziphites came up to Saul to Gibeah, saying, “Doesn’t David hide himself with us in the strongholds in the woods, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the south of the desert?

title: 1 Samuel 23:20
content: 20 Now therefore, O king, come down. According to all the desire of your soul to come down; and our part will be to deliver him up into the king’s hand.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:21
content: 21 Saul said, “You are blessed by the LORD, for you have had compassion on me.

title: 1 Samuel 23:22
content: 22 Please go make yet more sure, and know and see his place where his haunt is, and who has seen him there; for I have been told that he is very cunning.

title: 1 Samuel 23:23
content: 23 See therefore, and take knowledge of all the lurking places where he hides himself; and come again to me with certainty, and I will go with you. It shall happen, if he is in the land, that I will search him out among all the thousands of Judah.”

title: 1 Samuel 23:24
content: 24 They arose, and went to Ziph before Saul; but David and his men were in the wilderness of Maon, in the Arabah on the south of the desert.

title: 1 Samuel 23:25
content: 25 Saul and his men went to seek him. When David was told, he went down to the rock, and stayed in the wilderness of Maon. When Saul heard that, he pursued David in the wilderness of Maon.

title: 1 Samuel 23:26
content: 26 Saul went on this side of the mountain, and David and his men on that side of the mountain; and David hurried to get away for fear of Saul, for Saul and his men surrounded David and his men to take them.

title: 1 Samuel 23:27
content: 27 But a messenger came to Saul, saying, “Hurry and come, for the Philistines have made a raid on the land!”

title: 1 Samuel 23:28
content: 28 So Saul returned from pursuing David, and went against the Philistines. Therefore they called that place Sela Hammahlekoth.

title: 1 Samuel 23:29
content: 29 David went up from there and lived in the strongholds of En Gedi.

title: 1 Samuel 24:1
content: 1 When Saul had returned from following the Philistines, he was told, “Behold, David is in the wilderness of En Gedi.”

title: 1 Samuel 24:2
content: 2 Then Saul took three thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and went to seek David and his men on the rocks of the wild goats.

title: 1 Samuel 24:3
content: 3 He came to the sheep pens by the way, where there was a cave; and Saul went in to relieve himself. Now David and his men were staying in the innermost parts of the cave.

title: 1 Samuel 24:4
content: 4 David’s men said to him, “Behold, the day of which the LORD said to you, ‘Behold, I will deliver your enemy into your hand, and you shall do to him as it shall seem good to you.’” Then David arose and cut off the skirt of Saul’s robe secretly.

title: 1 Samuel 24:5
content: 5 Afterward, David’s heart struck him because he had cut off Saul’s skirt.

title: 1 Samuel 24:6
content: 6 He said to his men, “The LORD forbid that I should do this thing to my lord, the LORD’s anointed, to stretch out my hand against him, since he is the LORD’s anointed.”

title: 1 Samuel 24:7
content: 7 So David checked his men with these words, and didn’t allow them to rise against Saul. Saul rose up out of the cave, and went on his way.

title: 1 Samuel 24:8
content: 8 David also arose afterward, and went out of the cave and cried after Saul, saying, “My lord the king!” When Saul looked behind him, David bowed with his face to the earth, and showed respect.

title: 1 Samuel 24:9
content: 9 David said to Saul, “Why do you listen to men’s words, saying, ‘Behold, David seeks to harm you’?

title: 1 Samuel 24:10
content: 10 Behold, today your eyes have seen how the LORD had delivered you today into my hand in the cave. Some urged me to kill you, but I spared you. I said, ‘I will not stretch out my hand against my lord, for he is the LORD’s anointed.’

title: 1 Samuel 24:11
content: 11 Moreover, my father, behold, yes, see the skirt of your robe in my hand; for in that I cut off the skirt of your robe and didn’t kill you, know and see that there is neither evil nor disobedience in my hand. I have not sinned against you, though you hunt for my life to take it.

title: 1 Samuel 24:12
content: 12 May the LORD judge between me and you, and may the LORD avenge me of you; but my hand will not be on you.

title: 1 Samuel 24:13
content: 13 As the proverb of the ancients says, ‘Out of the wicked comes wickedness;’ but my hand will not be on you.

title: 1 Samuel 24:14
content: 14 Against whom has the king of Israel come out? Whom do you pursue? A dead dog? A flea?

title: 1 Samuel 24:15
content: 15 May the LORD therefore be judge, and give sentence between me and you, and see, and plead my cause, and deliver me out of your hand.”

title: 1 Samuel 24:16
content: 16 It came to pass, when David had finished speaking these words to Saul, that Saul said, “Is that your voice, my son David?” Saul lifted up his voice and wept.

title: 1 Samuel 24:17
content: 17 He said to David, “You are more righteous than I; for you have done good to me, whereas I have done evil to you.

title: 1 Samuel 24:18
content: 18 You have declared today how you have dealt well with me, because when the LORD had delivered me up into your hand, you didn’t kill me.

title: 1 Samuel 24:19
content: 19 For if a man finds his enemy, will he let him go away unharmed? Therefore may the LORD reward you good for that which you have done to me today.

title: 1 Samuel 24:20
content: 20 Now, behold, I know that you will surely be king, and that the kingdom of Israel will be established in your hand.

title: 1 Samuel 24:21
content: 21 Swear now therefore to me by the LORD that you will not cut off my offspring after me, and that you will not destroy my name out of my father’s house.”

title: 1 Samuel 24:22
content: 22 David swore to Saul. Saul went home, but David and his men went up to the stronghold.

title: 1 Samuel 25:1
content: 1 Samuel died; and all Israel gathered themselves together and mourned for him, and buried him at his house at Ramah. Then David arose and went down to the wilderness of Paran.

title: 1 Samuel 25:2
content: 2 There was a man in Maon whose possessions were in Carmel; and the man was very great. He had three thousand sheep and a thousand goats; and he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.

title: 1 Samuel 25:3
content: 3 Now the name of the man was Nabal; and the name of his wife Abigail. This woman was intelligent and had a beautiful face; but the man was surly and evil in his doings. He was of the house of Caleb.

title: 1 Samuel 25:4
content: 4 David heard in the wilderness that Nabal was shearing his sheep.

title: 1 Samuel 25:5
content: 5 David sent ten young men; and David said to the young men, “Go up to Carmel, and go to Nabal, and greet him in my name.

title: 1 Samuel 25:6
content: 6 Tell him, ‘Long life to you! Peace be to you! Peace be to your house! Peace be to all that you have!

title: 1 Samuel 25:7
content: 7 Now I have heard that you have shearers. Your shepherds have now been with us, and we didn’t harm them. Nothing was missing from them all the time they were in Carmel.

title: 1 Samuel 25:8
content: 8 Ask your young men, and they will tell you. Therefore let the young men find favor in your eyes, for we come on a good day. Please give whatever comes to your hand to your servants and to your son David.’”

title: 1 Samuel 25:9
content: 9 When David’s young men came, they spoke to Nabal all those words in the name of David, and waited.

title: 1 Samuel 25:10
content: 10 Nabal answered David’s servants and said, “Who is David? Who is the son of Jesse? There are many servants who break away from their masters these days.

title: 1 Samuel 25:11
content: 11 Shall I then take my bread, my water, and my meat that I have killed for my shearers, and give it to men who I don’t know where they come from?”

title: 1 Samuel 25:12
content: 12 So David’s young men turned on their way and went back, and came and told him all these words.

title: 1 Samuel 25:13
content: 13 David said to his men, “Every man put on his sword!” Every man put on his sword. David also put on his sword. About four hundred men followed David, and two hundred stayed by the baggage.

title: 1 Samuel 25:14
content: 14 But one of the young men told Abigail, Nabal’s wife, saying, “Behold, David sent messengers out of the wilderness to greet our master; and he insulted them.

title: 1 Samuel 25:15
content: 15 But the men were very good to us, and we were not harmed, and we didn’t miss anything as long as we went with them, when we were in the fields.

title: 1 Samuel 25:16
content: 16 They were a wall to us both by night and by day, all the while we were with them keeping the sheep.

title: 1 Samuel 25:17
content: 17 Now therefore know and consider what you will do; for evil is determined against our master and against all his house, for he is such a worthless fellow that one can’t speak to him.”

title: 1 Samuel 25:18
content: 18 Then Abigail hurried and took two hundred loaves of bread, two containers of wine, five sheep ready dressed, five seahs of parched grain, one hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs, and laid them on donkeys.

title: 1 Samuel 25:19
content: 19 She said to her young men, “Go on before me. Behold, I am coming after you.” But she didn’t tell her husband, Nabal.

title: 1 Samuel 25:20
content: 20 As she rode on her donkey, and came down hidden by the mountain, behold, David and his men came down toward her, and she met them.

title: 1 Samuel 25:21
content: 21 Now David had said, “Surely in vain I have kept all that this fellow has in the wilderness, so that nothing was missed of all that pertained to him. He has returned me evil for good.

title: 1 Samuel 25:22
content: 22 God do so to the enemies of David, and more also, if I leave of all that belongs to him by the morning light so much as one who urinates on a wall.”

title: 1 Samuel 25:23
content: 23 When Abigail saw David, she hurried and got off her donkey, and fell before David on her face and bowed herself to the ground.

title: 1 Samuel 25:24
content: 24 She fell at his feet and said, “On me, my lord, on me be the blame! Please let your servant speak in your ears. Hear the words of your servant.

title: 1 Samuel 25:25
content: 25 Please don’t let my lord pay attention to this worthless fellow, Nabal, for as his name is, so is he. Nabal is his name, and folly is with him; but I, your servant, didn’t see my lord’s young men whom you sent.

title: 1 Samuel 25:26
content: 26 Now therefore, my lord, as the LORD lives and as your soul lives, since the LORD has withheld you from blood guiltiness and from avenging yourself with your own hand, now therefore let your enemies and those who seek evil to my lord be as Nabal.

title: 1 Samuel 25:27
content: 27 Now this present which your servant has brought to my lord, let it be given to the young men who follow my lord.

title: 1 Samuel 25:28
content: 28 Please forgive the trespass of your servant. For the LORD will certainly make my lord a sure house, because my lord fights the LORD’s battles. Evil will not be found in you all your days.

title: 1 Samuel 25:29
content: 29 Though men may rise up to pursue you and to seek your soul, yet the soul of my lord will be bound in the bundle of life with the LORD your God. He will sling out the souls of your enemies as from a sling’s pocket.

title: 1 Samuel 25:30
content: 30 It will come to pass, when the LORD has done to my lord according to all the good that he has spoken concerning you, and has appointed you prince over Israel,

title: 1 Samuel 25:31
content: 31 that this shall be no grief to you, nor offense of heart to my lord, either that you have shed blood without cause, or that my lord has avenged himself. When the LORD has dealt well with my lord, then remember your servant.”

title: 1 Samuel 25:32
content: 32 David said to Abigail, “Blessed is the LORD, the God of Israel, who sent you today to meet me!

title: 1 Samuel 25:33
content: 33 Blessed is your discretion, and blessed are you, who have kept me today from blood guiltiness, and from avenging myself with my own hand.

title: 1 Samuel 25:34
content: 34 For indeed, as the LORD the God of Israel lives, who has withheld me from harming you, unless you had hurried and come to meet me, surely there wouldn’t have been left to Nabal by the morning light so much as one who urinates on a wall.”

title: 1 Samuel 25:35
content: 35 So David received from her hand that which she had brought him. Then he said to her, “Go up in peace to your house. Behold, I have listened to your voice and have granted your request.”

title: 1 Samuel 25:36
content: 36 Abigail came to Nabal; and behold, he held a feast in his house like the feast of a king. Nabal’s heart was merry within him, for he was very drunk. Therefore she told him nothing until the morning light.

title: 1 Samuel 25:37
content: 37 In the morning, when the wine had gone out of Nabal, his wife told him these things; and his heart died within him, and he became as a stone.

title: 1 Samuel 25:38
content: 38 About ten days later, the LORD struck Nabal, so that he died.

title: 1 Samuel 25:39
content: 39 When David heard that Nabal was dead, he said, “Blessed is the LORD, who has pleaded the cause of my reproach from the hand of Nabal, and has kept back his servant from evil. The LORD has returned the evildoing of Nabal on his own head.” David sent and spoke concerning Abigail, to take her to himself as wife.

title: 1 Samuel 25:40
content: 40 When David’s servants had come to Abigail to Carmel, they spoke to her, saying, “David has sent us to you, to take you to him as wife.”

title: 1 Samuel 25:41
content: 41 She arose and bowed herself with her face to the earth, and said, “Behold, your servant is a servant to wash the feet of the servants of my lord.”

title: 1 Samuel 25:42
content: 42 Abigail hurriedly arose and rode on a donkey with her five maids who followed her; and she went after the messengers of David, and became his wife.

title: 1 Samuel 25:43
content: 43 David also took Ahinoam of Jezreel; and they both became his wives.

title: 1 Samuel 25:44
content: 44 Now Saul had given Michal his daughter, David’s wife, to Palti the son of Laish, who was of Gallim.

title: 1 Samuel 26:1
content: 1 The Ziphites came to Saul to Gibeah, saying, “Doesn’t David hide himself in the hill of Hachilah, which is before the desert?”

title: 1 Samuel 26:2
content: 2 Then Saul arose and went down to the wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.

title: 1 Samuel 26:3
content: 3 Saul encamped in the hill of Hachilah, which is before the desert, by the way. But David stayed in the wilderness, and he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.

title: 1 Samuel 26:4
content: 4 David therefore sent out spies, and understood that Saul had certainly come.

title: 1 Samuel 26:5
content: 5 Then David arose and came to the place where Saul had encamped; and David saw the place where Saul lay, with Abner the son of Ner, the captain of his army. Saul lay within the place of the wagons, and the people were encamped around him.

title: 1 Samuel 26:6
content: 6 Then David answered and said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother of Joab, saying, “Who will go down with me to Saul to the camp?” Abishai said, “I will go down with you.”

title: 1 Samuel 26:7
content: 7 So David and Abishai came to the people by night; and, behold, Saul lay sleeping within the place of the wagons, with his spear stuck in the ground at his head; and Abner and the people lay around him.

title: 1 Samuel 26:8
content: 8 Then Abishai said to David, “God has delivered up your enemy into your hand today. Now therefore please let me strike him with the spear to the earth at one stroke, and I will not strike him the second time.”

title: 1 Samuel 26:9
content: 9 David said to Abishai, “Don’t destroy him, for who can stretch out his hand against the LORD’s anointed, and be guiltless?”

title: 1 Samuel 26:10
content: 10 David said, “As the LORD lives, the LORD will strike him; or his day shall come to die, or he shall go down into battle and perish.

title: 1 Samuel 26:11
content: 11 The LORD forbid that I should stretch out my hand against the LORD’s anointed; but now please take the spear that is at his head and the jar of water, and let’s go.”

title: 1 Samuel 26:12
content: 12 So David took the spear and the jar of water from Saul’s head, and they went away. No man saw it, or knew it, nor did any awake; for they were all asleep, because a deep sleep from the LORD had fallen on them.

title: 1 Samuel 26:13
content: 13 Then David went over to the other side, and stood on the top of the mountain far away, a great space being between them;

title: 1 Samuel 26:14
content: 14 and David cried to the people, and to Abner the son of Ner, saying, “Don’t you answer, Abner?” Then Abner answered, “Who are you who calls to the king?”

title: 1 Samuel 26:15
content: 15 David said to Abner, “Aren’t you a man? Who is like you in Israel? Why then have you not kept watch over your lord the king? For one of the people came in to destroy your lord the king.

title: 1 Samuel 26:16
content: 16 This thing isn’t good that you have done. As the LORD lives, you are worthy to die, because you have not kept watch over your lord, the LORD’s anointed. Now see where the king’s spear is, and the jar of water that was at his head.”

title: 1 Samuel 26:17
content: 17 Saul recognized David’s voice, and said, “Is this your voice, my son David?” David said, “It is my voice, my lord, O king.”

title: 1 Samuel 26:18
content: 18 He said, “Why does my lord pursue his servant? For what have I done? What evil is in my hand?

title: 1 Samuel 26:19
content: 19 Now therefore, please let my lord the king hear the words of his servant. If it is so that the LORD has stirred you up against me, let him accept an offering. But if it is the children of men, they are cursed before the LORD; for they have driven me out today that I shouldn’t cling to the LORD’s inheritance, saying, ‘Go, serve other gods!’

title: 1 Samuel 26:20
content: 20 Now therefore, don’t let my blood fall to the earth away from the presence of the LORD; for the king of Israel has come out to seek a flea, as when one hunts a partridge in the mountains.”

title: 1 Samuel 26:21
content: 21 Then Saul said, “I have sinned. Return, my son David; for I will no more do you harm, because my life was precious in your eyes today. Behold, I have played the fool, and have erred exceedingly.”

title: 1 Samuel 26:22
content: 22 David answered, “Behold the spear, O king! Let one of the young men come over and get it.

title: 1 Samuel 26:23
content: 23 The LORD will render to every man his righteousness and his faithfulness; because the LORD delivered you into my hand today, and I wouldn’t stretch out my hand against the LORD’s anointed.

title: 1 Samuel 26:24
content: 24 Behold, as your life was respected today in my eyes, so let my life be respected in the LORD’s eyes, and let him deliver me out of all oppression.”

title: 1 Samuel 26:25
content: 25 Then Saul said to David, “You are blessed, my son David. You will both do mightily, and will surely prevail.” So David went his way, and Saul returned to his place.

title: 1 Samuel 27:1
content: 1 David said in his heart, “I will now perish one day by the hand of Saul. There is nothing better for me than that I should escape into the land of the Philistines; and Saul will despair of me, to seek me any more in all the borders of Israel. So I will escape out of his hand.”

title: 1 Samuel 27:2
content: 2 David arose and passed over, he and the six hundred men who were with him, to Achish the son of Maoch, king of Gath.

title: 1 Samuel 27:3
content: 3 David lived with Achish at Gath, he and his men, every man with his household, even David with his two wives, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess and Abigail the Carmelitess, Nabal’s wife.

title: 1 Samuel 27:4
content: 4 Saul was told that David had fled to Gath, so he stopped looking for him.

title: 1 Samuel 27:5
content: 5 David said to Achish, “If now I have found favor in your eyes, let them give me a place in one of the cities in the country, that I may dwell there. For why should your servant dwell in the royal city with you?”

title: 1 Samuel 27:6
content: 6 Then Achish gave him Ziklag that day: therefore Ziklag belongs to the kings of Judah to this day.

title: 1 Samuel 27:7
content: 7 The number of the days that David lived in the country of the Philistines was a full year and four months.

title: 1 Samuel 27:8
content: 8 David and his men went up and raided the Geshurites, the Girzites, and the Amalekites; for those were the inhabitants of the land who were of old, on the way to Shur, even to the land of Egypt.

title: 1 Samuel 27:9
content: 9 David struck the land, and saved no man or woman alive, and took away the sheep, the cattle, the donkeys, the camels, and the clothing. Then he returned, and came to Achish.

title: 1 Samuel 27:10
content: 10 Achish said, “Against whom have you made a raid today?” David said, “Against the South of Judah, against the South of the Jerahmeelites, and against the South of the Kenites.”

title: 1 Samuel 27:11
content: 11 David saved neither man nor woman alive to bring them to Gath, saying, “Lest they should tell about us, saying, ‘David did this, and this has been his way all the time he has lived in the country of the Philistines.’”

title: 1 Samuel 27:12
content: 12 Achish believed David, saying, “He has made his people Israel utterly to abhor him. Therefore he will be my servant forever.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:1
content: 1 In those days, the Philistines gathered their armies together for warfare, to fight with Israel. Achish said to David, “Know assuredly that you will go out with me in the army, you and your men.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:2
content: 2 David said to Achish, “Therefore you will know what your servant can do.” Achish said to David, “Therefore I will make you my bodyguard forever.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:3
content: 3 Now Samuel was dead, and all Israel had mourned for him and buried him in Ramah, even in his own city. Saul had sent away those who had familiar spirits and the wizards out of the land.

title: 1 Samuel 28:4
content: 4 The Philistines gathered themselves together, and came and encamped in Shunem; and Saul gathered all Israel together, and they encamped in Gilboa.

title: 1 Samuel 28:5
content: 5 When Saul saw the army of the Philistines, he was afraid, and his heart trembled greatly.

title: 1 Samuel 28:6
content: 6 When Saul inquired of the LORD, the LORD didn’t answer him by dreams, by Urim, or by prophets.

title: 1 Samuel 28:7
content: 7 Then Saul said to his servants, “Seek for me a woman who has a familiar spirit, that I may go to her and inquire of her.” His servants said to him, “Behold, there is a woman who has a familiar spirit at Endor.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:8
content: 8 Saul disguised himself and put on other clothing, and went, he and two men with him, and they came to the woman by night. Then he said, “Please consult for me by the familiar spirit, and bring me up whomever I shall name to you.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:9
content: 9 The woman said to him, “Behold, you know what Saul has done, how he has cut off those who have familiar spirits and the wizards out of the land. Why then do you lay a snare for my life, to cause me to die?”

title: 1 Samuel 28:10
content: 10 Saul swore to her by the LORD, saying, “As the LORD lives, no punishment will happen to you for this thing.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:11
content: 11 Then the woman said, “Whom shall I bring up to you?” He said, “Bring Samuel up for me.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:12
content: 12 When the woman saw Samuel, she cried with a loud voice; and the woman spoke to Saul, saying, “Why have you deceived me? For you are Saul!”

title: 1 Samuel 28:13
content: 13 The king said to her, “Don’t be afraid! What do you see?” The woman said to Saul, “I see a god coming up out of the earth.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:14
content: 14 He said to her, “What does he look like?” She said, “An old man comes up. He is covered with a robe.” Saul perceived that it was Samuel, and he bowed with his face to the ground, and showed respect.

title: 1 Samuel 28:15
content: 15 Samuel said to Saul, “Why have you disturbed me, to bring me up?” Saul answered, “I am very distressed; for the Philistines make war against me, and God has departed from me, and answers me no more, by prophets, or by dreams. Therefore I have called you, that you may make known to me what I shall do.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:16
content: 16 Samuel said, “Why then do you ask me, since the LORD has departed from you and has become your adversary?

title: 1 Samuel 28:17
content: 17 The LORD has done to you as he spoke by me. The LORD has torn the kingdom out of your hand and given it to your neighbor, even to David.

title: 1 Samuel 28:18
content: 18 Because you didn’t obey the LORD’s voice, and didn’t execute his fierce wrath on Amalek, therefore the LORD has done this thing to you today.

title: 1 Samuel 28:19
content: 19 Moreover the LORD will deliver Israel also with you into the hand of the Philistines; and tomorrow you and your sons will be with me. The LORD will deliver the army of Israel also into the hand of the Philistines.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:20
content: 20 Then Saul fell immediately his full length on the earth, and was terrified, because of Samuel’s words. There was no strength in him, for he had eaten no bread all day long or all night long.

title: 1 Samuel 28:21
content: 21 The woman came to Saul and saw that he was very troubled, and said to him, “Behold, your servant has listened to your voice, and I have put my life in my hand, and have listened to your words which you spoke to me.

title: 1 Samuel 28:22
content: 22 Now therefore, please listen also to the voice of your servant, and let me set a morsel of bread before you. Eat, that you may have strength when you go on your way.”

title: 1 Samuel 28:23
content: 23 But he refused, and said, “I will not eat.” But his servants, together with the woman, constrained him; and he listened to their voice. So he arose from the earth and sat on the bed.

title: 1 Samuel 28:24
content: 24 The woman had a fattened calf in the house. She hurried and killed it; and she took flour and kneaded it, and baked unleavened bread of it.

title: 1 Samuel 28:25
content: 25 She brought it before Saul and before his servants, and they ate. Then they rose up and went away that night.

title: 1 Samuel 29:1
content: 1 Now the Philistines gathered together all their armies to Aphek; and the Israelites encamped by the spring which is in Jezreel.

title: 1 Samuel 29:2
content: 2 The lords of the Philistines passed on by hundreds and by thousands; and David and his men passed on in the rear with Achish.

title: 1 Samuel 29:3
content: 3 Then the princes of the Philistines said, “What about these Hebrews?” Achish said to the princes of the Philistines, “Isn’t this David, the servant of Saul the king of Israel, who has been with me these days, or rather these years? I have found no fault in him since he fell away until today.”

title: 1 Samuel 29:4
content: 4 But the princes of the Philistines were angry with him; and the princes of the Philistines said to him, “Make the man return, that he may go back to his place where you have appointed him, and let him not go down with us to battle, lest in the battle he become an adversary to us. For with what should this fellow reconcile himself to his lord? Should it not be with the heads of these men?

title: 1 Samuel 29:5
content: 5 Isn’t this David, of whom people sang to one another in dances, saying, ‘Saul has slain his thousands, and David his ten thousands’?”

title: 1 Samuel 29:6
content: 6 Then Achish called David and said to him, “As the LORD lives, you have been upright, and your going out and your coming in with me in the army is good in my sight; for I have not found evil in you since the day of your coming to me to this day. Nevertheless, the lords don’t favor you.

title: 1 Samuel 29:7
content: 7 Therefore now return, and go in peace, that you not displease the lords of the Philistines.”

title: 1 Samuel 29:8
content: 8 David said to Achish, “But what have I done? What have you found in your servant so long as I have been before you to this day, that I may not go and fight against the enemies of my lord the king?”

title: 1 Samuel 29:9
content: 9 Achish answered David, “I know that you are good in my sight, as an angel of God. Notwithstanding, the princes of the Philistines have said, ‘He shall not go up with us to the battle.’

title: 1 Samuel 29:10
content: 10 Therefore now rise up early in the morning with the servants of your lord who have come with you; and as soon as you are up early in the morning and have light, depart.”

title: 1 Samuel 29:11
content: 11 So David rose up early, he and his men, to depart in the morning, to return into the land of the Philistines; and the Philistines went up to Jezreel.

title: 1 Samuel 30:1
content: 1 When David and his men had come to Ziklag on the third day, the Amalekites had made a raid on the South and on Ziklag, and had struck Ziklag and burned it with fire,

title: 1 Samuel 30:2
content: 2 and had taken captive the women and all who were in it, both small and great. They didn’t kill any, but carried them off and went their way.

title: 1 Samuel 30:3
content: 3 When David and his men came to the city, behold, it was burned with fire; and their wives, their sons, and their daughters were taken captive.

title: 1 Samuel 30:4
content: 4 Then David and the people who were with him lifted up their voice and wept until they had no more power to weep.

title: 1 Samuel 30:5
content: 5 David’s two wives were taken captive, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite.

title: 1 Samuel 30:6
content: 6 David was greatly distressed, for the people spoke of stoning him, because the souls of all the people were grieved, every man for his sons and for his daughters; but David strengthened himself in the LORD his God.

title: 1 Samuel 30:7
content: 7 David said to Abiathar the priest, the son of Ahimelech, “Please bring the ephod here to me.” Abiathar brought the ephod to David.

title: 1 Samuel 30:8
content: 8 David inquired of the LORD, saying, “If I pursue after this troop, will I overtake them?” He answered him, “Pursue, for you will surely overtake them, and will without fail recover all.”

title: 1 Samuel 30:9
content: 9 So David went, he and the six hundred men who were with him, and came to the brook Besor, where those who were left behind stayed.

title: 1 Samuel 30:10
content: 10 But David pursued, he and four hundred men; for two hundred stayed behind, who were so faint that they couldn’t go over the brook Besor.

title: 1 Samuel 30:11
content: 11 They found an Egyptian in the field, and brought him to David, and gave him bread, and he ate; and they gave him water to drink.

title: 1 Samuel 30:12
content: 12 They gave him a piece of a cake of figs and two clusters of raisins. When he had eaten, his spirit came again to him; for he had eaten no bread, and drank no water for three days and three nights.

title: 1 Samuel 30:13
content: 13 David asked him, “To whom do you belong? Where are you from?” He said, “I am a young man of Egypt, servant to an Amalekite; and my master left me, because three days ago I got sick.

title: 1 Samuel 30:14
content: 14 We made a raid on the South of the Cherethites, and on that which belongs to Judah, and on the South of Caleb; and we burned Ziklag with fire.”

title: 1 Samuel 30:15
content: 15 David said to him, “Will you bring me down to this troop?” He said, “Swear to me by God that you will not kill me and not deliver me up into the hands of my master, and I will bring you down to this troop.”

title: 1 Samuel 30:16
content: 16 When he had brought him down, behold, they were spread around over all the ground, eating, drinking, and dancing, because of all the great plunder that they had taken out of the land of the Philistines, and out of the land of Judah.

title: 1 Samuel 30:17
content: 17 David struck them from the twilight even to the evening of the next day. Not a man of them escaped from there, except four hundred young men who rode on camels and fled.

title: 1 Samuel 30:18
content: 18 David recovered all that the Amalekites had taken, and David rescued his two wives.

title: 1 Samuel 30:19
content: 19 There was nothing lacking to them, neither small nor great, neither sons nor daughters, neither plunder, nor anything that they had taken. David brought them all back.

title: 1 Samuel 30:20
content: 20 David took all the flocks and the herds, which they drove before those other livestock, and said, “This is David’s plunder.”

title: 1 Samuel 30:21
content: 21 David came to the two hundred men, who were so faint that they could not follow David, whom also they had made to stay at the brook Besor; and they went out to meet David, and to meet the people who were with him. When David came near to the people, he greeted them.

title: 1 Samuel 30:22
content: 22 Then all the wicked men and worthless fellows of those who went with David answered and said, “Because they didn’t go with us, we will not give them anything of the plunder that we have recovered, except to every man his wife and his children, that he may lead them away and depart.”

title: 1 Samuel 30:23
content: 23 Then David said, “Do not do so, my brothers, with that which the LORD has given to us, who has preserved us, and delivered the troop that came against us into our hand.

title: 1 Samuel 30:24
content: 24 Who will listen to you in this matter? For as his share is who goes down to the battle, so shall his share be who stays with the baggage. They shall share alike.”

title: 1 Samuel 30:25
content: 25 It was so from that day forward that he made it a statute and an ordinance for Israel to this day.

title: 1 Samuel 30:26
content: 26 When David came to Ziklag, he sent some of the plunder to the elders of Judah, even to his friends, saying, “Behold, a present for you from the plunder of the LORD’s enemies.”

title: 1 Samuel 30:27
content: 27 He sent it to those who were in Bethel, to those who were in Ramoth of the South, to those who were in Jattir,

title: 1 Samuel 30:28
content: 28 to those who were in Aroer, to those who were in Siphmoth, to those who were in Eshtemoa,

title: 1 Samuel 30:29
content: 29 to those who were in Racal, to those who were in the cities of the Jerahmeelites, to those who were in the cities of the Kenites,

title: 1 Samuel 30:30
content: 30 to those who were in Hormah, to those who were in Borashan, to those who were in Athach,

title: 1 Samuel 30:31
content: 31 to those who were in Hebron, and to all the places where David himself and his men used to stay.

title: 1 Samuel 31:1
content: 1 Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain on Mount Gilboa.

title: 1 Samuel 31:2
content: 2 The Philistines overtook Saul and his sons; and the Philistines killed Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua, the sons of Saul.

title: 1 Samuel 31:3
content: 3 The battle went hard against Saul, and the archers overtook him; and he was greatly distressed by reason of the archers.

title: 1 Samuel 31:4
content: 4 Then Saul said to his armor bearer, “Draw your sword, and thrust me through with it, lest these uncircumcised come and thrust me through and abuse me!” But his armor bearer would not, for he was terrified. Therefore Saul took his sword and fell on it.

title: 1 Samuel 31:5
content: 5 When his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell on his sword, and died with him.

title: 1 Samuel 31:6
content: 6 So Saul died with his three sons, his armor bearer, and all his men that same day together.

title: 1 Samuel 31:7
content: 7 When the men of Israel who were on the other side of the valley, and those who were beyond the Jordan, saw that the men of Israel fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned the cities and fled; and the Philistines came and lived in them.

title: 1 Samuel 31:8
content: 8 On the next day, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, they found Saul and his three sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.

title: 1 Samuel 31:9
content: 9 They cut off his head, stripped off his armor, and sent into the land of the Philistines all around, to carry the news to the house of their idols and to the people.

title: 1 Samuel 31:10
content: 10 They put his armor in the house of the Ashtaroth, and they fastened his body to the wall of Beth Shan.

title: 1 Samuel 31:11
content: 11 When the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul,

title: 1 Samuel 31:12
content: 12 all the valiant men arose, went all night, and took the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons from the wall of Beth Shan; and they came to Jabesh and burned them there.

title: 1 Samuel 31:13
content: 13 They took their bones and buried them under the tamarisk tree in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
